author: {'steamid': '76561198072070416', 'num_games_owned': 202, 'num_reviews': 100, 'playtime_forever': 178, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 178, 'last_played': 1554395018}
review:
The most creative RTS to ever exist, bar none! 
You have over 12 races with their own units and playstyles, you have a warlord that can be any race and one of dozens of classes, you have a unit leveling up system where they gain ranks and if they reach a certain point they not only become stronger but also become named characters that you can take with you to other missions, your Warlord is like a meta progression you can take it to other games, there are titan units, one for each race that are huge and powerful and you can only make one of, there are quests in a match itself where you get rewards if you complete it, there are neutral buildings you can convert to train unique units, there are neutral buildings that periodically pump out neutral units that attack anyone and if you destroy it a boss lvl unit pops out to attack you, the visuals still hold up to this day and the controls aren't bad either. Definitely a diamond from the golden age of RTS, they don't make it like this anymore, I still dream of a new one coming out but I fear they'll just ruin it like companies ruin everything about our childhood nowadays.
PSA: Anyone considering buying this know that the Ironman hero mode doesn't work

review: This game takes me back. I would love to see a new Warlords: Battlecry game like this one but BETTER. Keep everything about this game and make it a game developed with higher resolution. An AoE-style RTS with a hero that has a character sheet like DND set in strange lands gripped with necromancy and evil creatures. The deep customization and battlefield loot is addictive. Someone scoop up this gem and make it modern but don't F#*$ing change it. PLEEEEAASSEE! {^_^}

author: {'steamid': '76561197983294661', 'num_games_owned': 771, 'num_reviews': 31, 'playtime_forever': 1697, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1697, 'last_played': 1676731420}
review: Warlords Battlecry 3 это такой Warcraft 3, который графически вернули во времена Starcraft, подрезали макро и героя разрешили иметь только одного, но зато работающего по правилам Дьяблы. К тому же он сохраняется между миссиями в кампании и умеет захватывать вражеские здания телепатией. Шахты захватываются таким же образом, рабочих туда отправлять необязательно. Просто строишь здания и фигачишь юнитов, которые, кстати, тоже прокачиваются и могут переноситься в свиту героя для последующих битв. А битв в кампании куча, тут целая глобальная карта со столицами рас, магазинами и засадами. Рас куча, классов героев куча, контента много и сомневаюсь, что подобную игру в 2004-м можно было бы сделать в 3D. Фанаты игру обожают и по сей день разрабатывают гигантский мод The Protectors of Etheria, зацените на ModDB, если оригинал понравится.

The Ai cheats more than any game i've ever seen, like I get it, but to "increase difficulty" it just ignores rules as opposed to any effort in a better ai and spams units far beyond there are resources on the map, the game WILL NOT WORK unless you get third party downloads. It's old, it's bad, it doesn't hold up but was fun in 2000. On top of that it has more bugs than a spilt soda left out in the sun. A wonderful idea with the worst execution from the horrible lazy devs. Yeah 505 and Fawkner.

author: {'steamid': '76561198212437563', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 237, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 207, 'last_played': 1704694020}
review:
This perfectly combines the aspects of an RPG and an RTS. Similar in vane to Warcraft however you start the game with your own personal hero that you have created. However, the hero can be customized with various races and classes that can effect the stats and skills of them and their level and equipment can be carried across matches. There are also various factions/races that you can command with your hero which creates a wide variety of playstyles in comparison to other rts games.

Matches operate similar to other rts games in a top down view where you must simultaneously expand and attack your opponent to win. With there being resources that you must capture using your hero. There are certain buildings that can give you quests for additional xp or rewards such as units. Unlike other rts, workers don't take up population. Only military units do which can put a greater importance on booming.

One scary prospect of this game that separates it from other rts/rpg hybrids such as Warcraft is that if your hero character dies during a match then they are perma dead for the remainder of that match. This will make you unable to capture buildings and unable to cast powerful spells which can give a massive advantage to your opponent. Making microing your hero far more important. There is also an option to choose to play ironman mode when making a hero which makes it to where if you die with that hero then they are completely gone forever as an additional challenge. 

All in all the variety of factions you can play as plus the mechanics of managing your hero provide a unique experience that few other games can replicate and I highly suggest giving the game a shot despite it's dated look. Definitely deserves a remaster and from what I have heard a modding community is doing just that.

author: {'steamid': '76561197983304131', 'num_games_owned': 380, 'num_reviews': 83, 'playtime_forever': 213, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 213, 'last_played': 1517966800}
review:
*Review still valid, but since writing heard of the standalone "Protectors" mod, updates the game to support HD res etc, prob safer bet than trying to get a decade plus version of the game to run on a modern PC*

Played way more than 3 hours, had this when I was a kid eons ago.

Great game, prob need look into mods tho to get it running on a modern PC(I'm just assuming, haven't tried in a while but had issues last I did)

If you're running on a "potato" though, and looking for a solid old RTS and worried about the "offbrand" series might not be able to find a huge amount of info about...well, then you've come to the right place.

Before we had stuff like Warhammer Total War, there was this. 

Gameplay wise it is a conventional RTS, no weird ish', tons of diff factions(all have unique units and mechanics), can level up your commanders, equip items etc, just all around an awesome game can spend hours on. 

Even back in the day was a bit of an adjustment factor to figure out mechanics etc (coming off stuff like Warcraft 3 with much more simple interface and mechanics) but once I figured this game out, I couldn't put it down for a couple years after wards.

author: {'steamid': '76561198057327199', 'num_games_owned': 251, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 7369, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 7369, 'last_played': 1534665456}
review:
Parádní, chytlavá, fantazi, strategická/rpg hra, ovšem tady na steamu to nekupujte. Je to v neoficiální verzi, ve které se vám ukládá pouze 1 hrdina a někdy ho neuloží vůbec. A je zde spousty nechtěných změn a rebalanců.

Pokud to už tedy koupíte, jako já, tak to doporučuji patchnout zpět na oficiální verzi 1. 03, nebo si z fandom stránek stáhnout mód protectors, pokud si chcete zahrát kompletní, komunitní remake hry.

+ různorodé národy v zástupu jednoho unikátního hrdiny.

+ skvělý soundtrack

+ možnost vytvořit si vlastní mapu v editoru

+ neomezené úrovně hrdiny

- neomezené úrovně hrdinů může na vyšších úrovních proměnit hru ze strategie na naháněčku nepřátelského hrdiny, kde pak jeho smrt znamená vaše jasné vítězství.

- velice pomalé levelování oproti wb2.

Dávám 8/10, hra je rozhodně super, ty dva body srážím za nevybalancovaný úrovňový systém, který se razantně zhoršil od předchozího dílu.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997201265', 'num_games_owned': 97, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 21, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 21, 'last_played': 1685466363}
review:
A excelent blend of an rpg and rts, extremely fun to play.

author: {'steamid': '76561198299637676', 'num_games_owned': 81, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 60, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 60, 'last_played': 1652390515}
review: This game was, without a doubt, one of the best in the RTS genre if not one of the best of all time. It was bigly ahead of it's time in so many ways. It was the first RTS to have a persistent player avatar that could be leveled up, with many options for customization. It was one of the only RTS to have ever allowed so many varied playstyles, as each race had different strengths and tactics. It perfectly blended the previous two points to allow you to tailor your game experience to have whatever kind of feel you wanted. The amount of development that had to have gone into making this all happen is mind blowing. More games should do this. This is hands down one of my favorite games of all time.

author: {'steamid': '76561198358736815', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 6195, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5908, 'last_played': 1684277418}

author: {'steamid': '76561197994000096', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 10254, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 364, 'playtime_at_review': 8544, 'last_played': 1712260510}
review:
Fantastic RTS strategy game, with great levelling hero RPG elements. 16 races that play very differently with interesting fantasy creatures, buildings and magic. Masses of different units, unique and interesting hero builds and progression....and horrendously unbalanced! - but that's why it's fun! Nothing like finding a loophole in a hero build and using it to take down hordes of opponents' units!

The art style and visuals have really stood up well, though would recommend getting the widescreen patch and installing the official 1.03 version over the unofficial 1.03.24 version that Steam is bundled with. Really hoping a WBC4 is at least being thought about; this is definitely a hidden gem!

review: gameplay is great as always. however, the thing i noticed is if i minimize the game to desktop and go back, the screen glitches. samples are the mouse cursor keeps on blinking, the display on the bottom loses animations, the map blinks as well sometimes its just black. i have tried going back to desktop and back to the game again but still same issue remains. so bc of that i have to quit the app instead of just going back to where i left in order to get the proper screen again. meanwhile, no issues with gameplay whatsoever, just the display issue

author: {'steamid': '76561198115146638', 'num_games_owned': 2197, 'num_reviews': 126, 'playtime_forever': 1041, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 797, 'last_played': 1677438879}
review:
The Warlords Battlecry series was an RTS with RPG elements spin-off of the classic Warlords series. This is the third and arguably most complete iteration. In the Battlecry series you create a hero out of over a dozen races and then proceed to command their factions to victory in a sprawling campaign, as well as a fun and easily moddable skirmish/scenario mode. The various factions favour different playstyles, they may not necessarily be ideally balanced but that's hardly the point. There is simply something for everyone here. From slow to recruit, but tough as nails minotaurs, to squishy, but fast and deadly fey. It's about variety and fun, more than stale scientific balance. The game's rich lore also fleshes them out and makes them that much more engaging and fun to play with.

Unfortunately, this Steam version of the game is the old version from nearly 20 years without any fixes, extras or optimisations. It only plays on fullscreen, supports precious few, and by now ancient, resolutions and so on. Effectively, it's a lazy port. I am sure glad to be able to buy and replay this great classic, but I would have liked some extra polish to go with the re-release. If anything I even noticed crashes this time around, that I didn't notice back then. Likely because the game is less compatible with modern hardware. Thankfully, the modders have yet again saved the day. There is an easy to get unofficial patch, v1.04, that provides support for windowed mode and various resolutions, as well as other fixes. It's a must.

This is one of my favourite games of all time. I have always been fond of its world and its premise. Building up my hero into a real badass and just watching as he's unleashed upon the game's rich world. It was always a treat. With the unofficial patch, this is still a joy to play, almost as much as it was back then. It does miss some CRT goodness I guess. I know it's been nearly 20 years, but I'm still hoping for a Battlecry 4. Maybe one day. I highly recommend this game to all fans of classic RTS games.

author: {'steamid': '76561198312490485', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 657, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 262, 'last_played': 1677542652}
review:
Esse jogo fez parte da minha infância junto com Diablo 2, Little Fighter 2, Cultures e entre outros jogos dos anos 2000. Mesmo após vários anos, ele continua sendo divertido. Os gráficos podem até estar ultrapassados, mas a diversão continua a mesma.
Neste jogo você pode montar o seu herói escolhendo a raça e a classe no qual são bem diversas, com seus pontos fortes e fracos. Existem diversos cenários onde você pode lutar com até 6 participantes (contando com você mesmo), deixando o jogo mais divertido. No decorrer do jogo você poderá encontrar itens para equipar no seu Herói.
O modo história é muito bom e bem diverso. Você tem vários tipos de missões, desde as principais até as opcionais para ganhar itens.
É um jogo divertido, mesmo nos tempos atuais.

author: {'steamid': '76561198251445210', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 2107, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2101, 'last_played': 1671041185}
review:
Warlords Battlecry 3

When I found out that this title is also here on steam, I immediately had to buy it. This is a favorite of mine from when I had the game on CD. WB 3 is a magic strategy that also has its own story. There are really many factions/nations here, so everyone can really find something for themselves. A big role is played by your leader or main character, who can convert buildings or mines into resources, but you can also improve his fighting skills or spells and magic. You can also completely revive the story with The Protectors mod, where the community has created a completely different storyline and other modifications. I think there is even a functional MP here. The best factions for me are probably the Empire, Minotaurs and Necromancers. As I already mentioned, this game is close to my heart and I will always be happy to return to it.

author: {'steamid': '76561197993197909', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 2769, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2370, 'last_played': 1688507556}
review:
How is this still the best pure RTS after all these years?  Sure, I need to change my resolution to 1280x1024.  Sure, I can't alt tab while playing but at least it boots up in seconds so exiting typically isn't an issue.  Sure, the multiplayer lobby is broken, but I play with my two friends fine over 'TCP/IP Internet'.

It has 16 well balanced races and with the diverse heroes you start the match with for as long as you can keep them alive (stick them in towers when hurt, if Minotaur hero make some sheep to eat) and all the spells, each are completely viable to many different strategies.  You don't need to worry about workers gathering resources, just capture mines and if your team has workers you can send them up to 8 into the mine to gather faster and not even count against your unit cap.  If your doing a skirmish (and aren't using someone with Rune Magic) I suggest putting on Tough Starting Towers, you may want to do the Campaign a bit to get them decent gear also which can be brought to multiplayer along with a Retinue of up to 8 leveled units from any race (Treant as fastest builder and a low cost general like Nymph to help get mines early without endangering your hero much suggested, but like you can bring Trolls to the Minotaur race team and load them up with deadly sheep to throw, unicorn/white mage healing helps keep heroes without other ways to heal alive set as a magic guardian on them).  Personally my current favorite combo is Orc Runemaster leading Orcs, but Wood Elf Ranger leading Fey(High XP/Life Dragons end game), Empire/Dwarves/Wood Elf (Good XP/Life Griffons mid game) is good too.

I recommend Minotaur Pyromancer on Minotaurs race to start.  Simple super upgradable units with good buff spells for them.

This is updated beyond the CD and patched version, beyond including the GoG version(And IP connected fights work again is the big win); With some balance stuff like limited time on most summons and some nice changes into what the hero stats effect.  The only new issue seems that sometimes enemies will somehow get stuck inside your units and they won't be targetable until you pull them off them.  Fairly rare and never happened when I actually care mostly just when chasing a worker or something down.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096710599', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 868, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 868, 'last_played': 1503344067}

author: {'steamid': '76561198000238483', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2492, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 755, 'last_played': 1667693186}
review:
One of my favorite games of all time. I played so many hours of this before the Steam version, but I find that this is stable for the most part, even in multiplayer. A few times, you need to exit the app and relaunch when playing matches in a row, and if you alt tab out of the app, there are some issues with the cursor. 
The game itself is amazing. The variety of different races, each with completely different playstyles and strengths and weaknesses, as well as the number of different kinds of heroes is outstanding. The fact that all your creatures level up too, and you can keep some in a retinue is pretty awesome. The campaign lets you capture certain regions that give you bonuses in subsequent battles, so that makes it feel like there is a real progression when gaining more territory. I wish they'd make a Warlords Battlecry IV with updated graphics, but just as much variety.

author: {'steamid': '76561198137284043', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 761, 'playtime_forever': 305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 305, 'last_played': 1660066767}
review:
I would still say Warlords Battlecry 2 is the best game in the series, but this is better than nothing... I guess.

Anyway, I always liked the concept of a hero that plays like a roleplaying character and his troops. A maxed out hero can pretty much take an entire base on his own and it's really fun when you reach that point.

The campaign map just isn't as interesting as in 2 because there was this constant movement between factions and here you just go from mission to mission. They also added a few more factions and some small improvements overall.

There's also only a maximum resolution of 1280x1020. A remaster would be prefered.

author: {'steamid': '76561198957921881', 'num_games_owned': 576, 'num_reviews': 398, 'playtime_forever': 5274, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 296, 'last_played': 1675319502}
review:
[h1] 𝕀'𝕝𝕝 𝕓𝕖 𝕣𝕖𝕧𝕚𝕖𝕨𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕨𝕙𝕒𝕥 𝕀'𝕞 𝕡𝕝𝕒𝕪𝕚𝕟𝕘, 𝕒𝕟𝕕 𝕀'𝕞 𝕡𝕝𝕒𝕪𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕒 𝕄𝕠𝕕 𝕥𝕠 𝕥𝕙𝕚𝕤 𝕕𝕖𝕒𝕕 𝕠𝕝𝕕 𝕘𝕒𝕞𝕖 𝕥𝕙𝕒𝕥 𝕙𝕒𝕤 𝕓𝕖𝕖𝕟 𝕞𝕖𝕣𝕘𝕚𝕟𝕘 𝕓𝕠𝕥𝕙 ℝℙ𝔾 𝕒𝕟𝕕 ℝ𝕋𝕊 𝕘𝕖𝕟𝕣𝕖𝕤 𝕥𝕠 𝕡𝕖𝕣𝕗𝕖𝕔𝕥𝕚𝕠𝕟. [/h1]

The devs leaving this game for dead is really why we can't have good things. Welcome warlords (and warladies) to the world of Etheria; a world where mythical creatures, elves, orcs, undead, beasts and humans fight over control. Warlords Battlecry is one of the few game franchises that successfully mixes between RTS and RPG; Warcraft 3 did it but there was no specific hero progression, Spellforce did it but the characters were kind of "personified" and blandly so... Warlords Battlecry succeeds in giving you a role-playing experience, with heroes from a mythical world and an actual RPG progression to boot.

The gist is simple, you start off by converting mines, the mines make up for your resources that you use to raise an army. There are over 12 races in the original game and the reason why people who play this game DON'T actually play this game but they instead get a free mod called The Protectors, is that the original game is a buggy, unbalanced mess, relied a lot on a singular unit and was just overall crappy in so many ways that I'm not going to state here. It also cannot run on newer computers, hence why you won't find many people playing the original product anyways.

Now let me describe The Protectors mod; first off it's got some amazing moderators supervising the project, which means the future is looking bright for Warlords Battlecry. Secondly, the Protectors mod contains the whole DELUXE experience: campaigns from the first, second and third games (that have disappeared from Steam), balance, races actually feel more alive than ever before, classes actually matter now and are well-balanced... You can be anything you can expect to be in an RPG world set in a medieval mythical setting... Wanna be a Barbarian warrior versed in the art of "melee your enemy till they drop"? Check! Wanna be maybe an elf who can cast... mmmm... Ice magic? Check! Or maybe you want to be sneaky, you want to play Metal Gear Solid in an RTS game, and that's why you're using a sneaky chameleon from the Ssrathi dinosaur race with Illusion magic? ALSO CHECK! Wanna say "screw it" and cast every SPELL THERE IS?? ARCHMAGE HUGE CHECK!

I mean, I used to play the heck out of these "messy games" as a child, and now with this mod alive and a big discord community, what is there to complain about? All I could say is: "What a great time to be alive!". The product you'd be getting with Warlords Battlecry III in your cart could be rated [b]5/10[/b], 2/10 if it won't run on your pc lol... Do a little bit of research, and you've got yourself a [b]10/10[/b] masterpiece to be enjoyed for a lifetime.

author: {'steamid': '76561198066496454', 'num_games_owned': 288, 'num_reviews': 117, 'playtime_forever': 1814, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1814, 'last_played': 1645295689}
review:
"Warlords Battlecry III" is a third game in a spin-off series of TBS "Warlords". Only old people remember this franchise so I won't bother you with more history lessons. 
"Warlords Battlecry" series is a blend of RPG and RTS (which was introduced way before Warcraft III). I guess everyone knows what that means. 
The campaign is pretty enjoyable and non-linear. There is also some replayability (obviously expected from the game with 16 different races) and different hero-builds.
If you miss good old RTS days "WBIII" can bring you back in time and satiate your nostalgia. But I have to admit that "Warlords Battlecry II" is slightly better and superior to the third of first installments of the series.

author: {'steamid': '76561198352156367', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 525, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 525, 'last_played': 1656613563}
review:
Great game with large old school fanbase BUT..... The steam version is a modded version and NOT the official version. I would not recommend it until they change it to a working OFFICIAL 1.03 version not the unofficial 1.03.24 version which changes a lot of the core rules of the original game. Also BEWARE this game is OLD and 
the graphics may have problems with newer machines (such as) resolutions not working properly or just outright crashing.

review: Opolerat men riktigt charmigt. Det är riktigt tillfredställande att skapa en OP hero och sola igenom campagnen med denne. Men också ett riktigt bra RTS med massa unika raser med hard counters och map-domination där man får vara riktigt försiktig för att inte förlora sin värdefulla hero!

author: {'steamid': '76561198103292312', 'num_games_owned': 215, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1312, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1312, 'last_played': 1506185257}
review:
The only RTS series that genuinely tried to inject RPG mechanics & Hero progression into the game and was somewhat successful IMO. But now it's abandoned and what's left is an unbalanced, buggy mess, oh well... 

FYI: The source code has been left to it's little community for years now, but right now they're mostly diluting the experience in favour of a more generic RTS one and polishing - or more appropriately "sand-papering" - it to such an extent that it's losing it's edge. Guys, part of the fun of this game was making your Hero incredibly OP after hours of investment (I.e. collecting the right gear, EXP farming and thinking up creative builds etc), dumbing that aspect down too much is just going to make this game entirely IRRELEVANT in the grand scheme.

author: {'steamid': '76561198004261261', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 1512, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1031, 'last_played': 1670932773}

author: {'steamid': '76561198006892083', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 9, 'playtime_forever': 1367, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1303, 'last_played': 1662363659}
review:
It's an old one, but as far as I have found, there is no other like it.

Plenty of factions to choose from, each sporting their own unique units and series of pros/cons.

Create a hero whose direction and style of combat are totally within your control. Bow-wielding healer? Sure! Tanky summoner? Go for it! The hero can be any of the available races and sports their own equipment that  helps to shape your own playstyle. The hero earns exp throughout battle and will only get stronger. There is an option to make a permadeath hero, high risk/high reward ( in the form of massive exp bonuses ).

Keep units at the end of the battle that you can carry with your hero, who earn exp and gain power as long as they live.

Full-fledged campaign that you can take on at your own pace, I am just now after many years beginning to explore this side of this game.

Custom maps/scenarios.

I prefer to skirmish the shit out of this game, and I would not be surprised if multiplayer were dead for this game, though I may just go find out. The AI provide challenge enough for me, but for professional RTS-ers this game may be lacking in the long run for you after a time.

All-in-all I still highly recommend this game to any single person who enjoys RTS for the pure fun of having a persistent hero to level up and have epic battles with. 

My current hero is a summoner who does not need much in terms of base-building, and I will often just make sure I have some kind of research to increase mana regen so I can just send relentless armies after my opponents. 

Also check out The Protectors if you find this one is interesting but want a tad more depth! I am pretty sure it is a standalone mod for the second installment of this game, and has MUCH more to it, either way enjoy!

author: {'steamid': '76561198005882636', 'num_games_owned': 451, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 1706, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1410, 'last_played': 1639182977}
review:
It is a childhood memory for me and some races and heroes builds are broken, but the charme and fun still is there for me.
I have never seen more races than in this game, so there is for sure something for everyone there. 
Sure, they are all quite similar, but all look different and you can see that the developers put really love in their design, so in the end they feel kinda different!

This version is very crappy and needs some time to be fixed with downloaded some fixes and still then, it is a poor transition to Steam and crashes very often. Especially the save game issue was very annoying, but I could manage them thanks to pretty good posts of some other players in the discussion forum here on Steam (definitely go there at first before even trying to run the game!).

If you can accept all these issues, you will get a good game from a different era of computer games, hence my nostalgically affected thumb goes up!

6.5/10

review: The game is a lot of fun, campaign is long, and the replayability is crazy with all the different races and classes you can be. There's a nice patch for it that allows you to play the game in 4k resolution... The only problem i have is, my characters and save files keep getting deleted, and I've literaly tried everything to fix that. I tried running it as admin, with windows service pack 3, but that still doesnt work, and I'm not even using ironman mode, nothing works! So I can't recommend this game to my friends with this character and save game issue.

author: {'steamid': '76561198062743512', 'num_games_owned': 564, 'num_reviews': 50, 'playtime_forever': 2427, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2427, 'last_played': 1621800477}
review: Trochę zapomniana strategia fantasy z własnym światem i historią. Gdzie bohaterowie mają własne armie i toczą między sobą wojny. Bardzo możliwe, że twórcy Warcrafta 3 wzorowali się na tej grze i u siebie też wprowadzili mechanikę, gdzie osobno rozwijamy swojego bohatera niczym w grze rpg. Ale tam system rozbudowy postaci nijak się ma do tego, co mamy tutaj. Trzecia część Warlordsów zawiera najwięcej ras, bodaj 14 albo 16 grywalnych ras i bohaterów, a do tego każdy bohater może być jedną z 20+ klas, które mają inne zdolności. Jednym słowem, gra jest bardzo rozbudowana i godna poznania.

review:
Es bietet durch seine vielen Völker und Truppen eine große strategische Varians. Für ein echtzeitstrategiespiel seiner Zeit ist es herrlich komplex und gleichzeitig schön balanciert.
Der individuell gestaltbare Held lässt viel Raum zur eigenen Gestaltung und Einfluss auf das Spielgschehen.

Schade das es zur Zeit keinen Nachfolger dieses Spiels gibt.

review:
So I'm seeming to have an issue that a lot of others are having...WBC 3 will NOT start on my laptop.
I have a HP 15-dw0054wm model and the game downloaded but when I click the shortcut, the screen goes black for maybe 3 seconds and then the game shuts down and sends me back to the Desktop screen. I've seen a lot of people talking about the screen resolution needing to be 800x600 but I don't have that as an option in my screen res. drop down menu. I've tried every compatibilty mode that is shown on the game and still nothing. Does anyone have an actual fix for this or is it still just the run around?? My laptop is Windows 10 and it's only a year and half old.

review: I played this game when I was much, much younger. It has aged as well as one might expect. There are definite flaws to the game, but that hardly diminishes the fun! For me, this is pure nostalgia, having bought this game coming off of Total Annihilation and C&C back in the day with a thirst for more RTS. This filled my bowl with happiness from the get go and the options provided make this combination of RPG and RTS a lot of fun to pursue. Hard recommend!

author: {'steamid': '76561198213666149', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 26, 'playtime_forever': 145, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 144, 'last_played': 1683563176}
review:
It breaks my heart to downvote one of my favorite games of all time, due to this unfortunate patch.
This game had many problems before, but we lived with them. 
Well, we'd hope to see them fixed, but they were not addressed at all.
It still crashes even more often, you still can't alt-tab w/o it crashing, you stll can't apply a modern resolution, it still can't play windowed without another patch or dxwnd app. 
I have kept a CD with a early 2k's version of the game that runs better that this version.(well,cracked, despite original, for the silly CD protection of the time, and in compatibility mode) At least it exits without crashing my desktop.

Only opinionated changes to gameplay were made, according to the personal preferences of those that made them.
Here are some of them:

TL;DR;

* Summoned creatures have become temporary, like they were illusionist's "illusionary warriors". Yeah, nurf the summoners, like a 30-level warrior wouldn't butcher like cattle any creature they could summon, no matter the level. Like there's not limit anyway to the amount of creatures you may have on the battlefield, summoned or otherwise.

* The gameplay has already terribly easy with melee classes and a bit challenging for spellcasters. In the campaign, you could dominate the battlefield with a warrior right away from level 1 (with a little caution up to 10). You could just give it its first levels to dexterity and ferocity, and by level 30 you may set it to rampage and let it win the map without your interference. It's very fun in the beginning, but it quickly becomes boring.
Playing a mage, now, is a constant struggle to reach a level that it is not a nightmare, a level on which you don't have to hide in towers (when playing pvp against warriors there's no such level), that a quasit can't kill you with a random critical. (no, those critical multipliers were not fixed: actually, less normal damage with the same effect of criticals means that the outcome of a battle relies even more to random factors)

* The hitpoints system was already injust for some classes, and it is made even worse here. You see, the game mechanics consists of combining 5 skills from a race and another 5 (or less) from a class. There are no special abilities native to a class to justify an hp (or mana) difference: you do what your skills let you do. Most skills in mages are also found in fighters; those that don't, don't really make any difference (all except the elcor's aura, but it's not just the healer that has lower hp and actually, among the mages it is priviledged to gain 2 hp/level while others gain 1). e.g: A dark elf summoner or daemonslayer have only 1 spell school, only the latter has lots of more hp, initial and per level, for a slight difference in mana.

* More hit points were given to the melee classes, especially the warrior, the class with already outrageously large amount (like they needed them), while they nurfed a bit their damage (in very high levels it doesn't matter anyway, since there's a max damage cap). In other words, your warrior is still impossible to die, like before, only now it will him take some more time to finish them off. Like trying hard to make the game boring. Like, you know, the one with the devil-synonym in it's title :-P

* Generally changes are in the direction of  'more hp, less damage', which is an unorthodox way to increase gameplay duration (for a game that doesn't need it) and a very efficient one to maximise boredom.

* Strength is now giving 5 points of health (instead of 3) and half the damage, making it utterly useless for characters below level 50. You already had enough health, you could over-compensate in combat with ferocity and a point of dexterity will you give much, much more: armor, resistance, attack speed and movement speed.

* Several skills were nurfed to the point that they became useless. I can see the logic behind some of the changes, but still, they were in the wrong direction. X-slayer skills (e.g manslayer, elfslayer), applying only to a limited subset of races, have been nurfed to the point of useless (i.e I was already reluctant to spend a point of an imperial hero for 10 more damage just to the Ssrathi, but now that it's 5, it's just a wasted skill. Whereas smite good/evil, each applying to almost half of the creatures, are left inteact to their full 10 damage.
* Elcor's aura is still terribly OP. I like it when I play healers, but it would be a point well-spent even if it gave 5 more hp instead of 20.
* Engineering (increasing the hp of your buildings) has changed in a way that probably seemed to them smart, but it isn't. It's now a relative percentage, which means that if your tower already had many hp, it will now gain even more without needing them, while there's no hope anymore for races with weak towers (like, say, the Fey). You can now grow your towers to outrageously large health without even seriously investing to the skill. If it was to be fixed, a more complicate formula should have been used, which would be confusing, therefore, it should be left as it was.
* This one could have been smart: leadership skill so far seemed useless, since it gave you 1 morale, while you race x-lord skill would give you 2. But instead of increasing Leadership to 2 morale / point, they nurfed all the x-lord skills, making your hero's race practically irrelevant to the one you're playing in a scenario.
* Shadow strength now gives 3 combat points, the same as ferocity... No dilemma anymore for orc assassins, I guess.
* Some classess were missing skills (the bard, the assassin, the merchant and the lamest of all, the thief) due to up-to-1.03 nurfs. They didn't bother to fill them up.
* Bonus-XP-for-creatures skills were also made useless. I.e. 2 xp per point to enhance just treants, a 4-level creature unique to the wood-elves? (I know, nature mages can summon them, too, but you must be really desperate to summon 1 treant instead of 2 unicorns). It was already a waste at 5, it's outrageously useless now at 2.
* Ignore armor has been buffed from 2 to 3. This one is the single correct change that I found.
* Ritual and Energy are still a useless waste of points (that's not this patch's fault, but it seems to me that whoever did the changes had never played a mage class). Ritual gives 5 just a bit more than what a single point of int from the aspect of spell chance (while, imho, it should give 10, like Lore) and it's a skill that, if you use an editor, you assign early in the game and later remove it to place somewhere useful; and energy's 5% / point means that you may as well spend 10 points to the Arcane and have the same effect bonus the spells, or that you have to spend 60 points to get the equivalent of L3 mana regeneration enchancement, bought in some races' buildings.
Note: a secondary skill, in order to be a worth it, should give you more than what 1 point of the base skill does in that aspect. For instance, ferocity gives 3 combat, while each point of strength gives 1: good deal. Lore gives 10, while each point of intelligence give 3. Also good. Merchant: 1 point, as 1 point of charisma. Not good. (although it can let you play a nice casual game enjoying the discounts with a character up to level 20 and then abandon it forever).
Leadership: 1 point, the poor side effect of what 1 point of charisma does. Horrible.

You could say from all these that I favor mages, but actually Deathknights and Assassins are my favourite ones (and are very much favored by this patch's changes) and my top level class is a Chieftain (because I can let it farm xp in auto). But I also happen to like exploring the game mechanics and combos (to which melee classes don't give much material), and I don't like breaking my nerves in the process.

I don't say that they should change anything according to my preferences. They shouldn't change anything at all. They could just fix the real breaking issues and leave the gameplay as it was in the game that we loved.

author: {'steamid': '76561198104347725', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 405, 'playtime_forever': 26, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 26, 'last_played': 1620573858}
review:
Есть диск, прошёл всю основную ветку и почти все допы за демонов. Не жалею, у демонов на начальном и конечном этапах есть летающие юниты, что даёт преимущество перед другими расами. Полная руссификация + озвучка от Акелы, но есть баг - магию нельзя использовать - вылетает, так же в некоторых побочных квестах-боях, тоже вылетает, поэтому прошёл не все побочки. 
В руководстве есть руссик, играбельный, магия доступна, но текст не весь переведён, хотя это мелочи. 
Игра стоящая, стиль старых RTS. Warlords Battlecry III - это среднее между Герои меча и магии 3 и Вар крафт 3.
Купил, чтобы проверить руссик, а так игра у меня уже есть, поэтому и возврат.
Куча разных классов и рас, но сюжет один, хотя много вариаций достижения целей, можно пытаться со всеми заключить союз или быть во враждебном состоянии со всеми расами. После прохождения компании игра не заканчивается, можно путешествовать по городам и проходить допы.
После пары полных компаний понимаешь, что магия здесь не такая уж клёвая вещь, лучше взять воина, (за нежить полезна магия некромантии, так как они сами по себе слабы). А у "добрых" рас все здания и умения схожи. За "злодеев" проходить интереснее, к тому же добро и зло здесь условные, всё решает дипломатия. Я вот играя за демона имел союзников как нежить, так и высших эльфов.
После пары полных компаний понимаешь, что магия здесь не такая уж клёвая вещь, лучше взять воина, (за нежить полезна магия некромантии, так как они сами по себе слабы). А у "добрых" рас все здания и умения схожи. За "злодеев" проходить интереснее, к тому же добро и зло здесь условные, всё решает дипломатия. Я вот играя за демона имел союзников как нежить, так и высших эльфов.

author: {'steamid': '76561198009249707', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 44, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 44, 'last_played': 1453759831}
review: Its literally installed with a fan made unofficial patch. This game was one of the favorites of my childhood, but the unofficial patch has "dragons" being their own race and they all look like balloon animals. Not to mention the mechanics changes to spells and the like. There is a patch online to revert it to a certain date, which solves most of the weird stuff that didnt come with the original, but in its current state, i woudl never recommend this game to anyone, even though it is deeply close to my heart. If you would like to   play the og version there IS a patch, made by the same person who made this unofficial mod. However its been a long time and im not very technical so i cannot provide a link, apologies. I love this game. I hate this version, and cannot suggest it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198021252986', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 354, 'playtime_forever': 243, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 24, 'last_played': 1616415238}
review:
Среди стратегий в реальном времени – наиболее эпичная. Главный недостаток – устаревшая графика, даже во время выхода (в 2004 игра выглядела как выпущенная в 1998, копируя стиль первого startcraft, хотя на тот момент уже появилась легендарная dawn of war). В steam-версии разрешение текстур немного повысили, однако до уровня «высшего класса» 2004 г. всё ещё далеко. Однако «военачальники» славятся не графикой, а обилием рас и юнитов. 
Мир игры – смесь warhammer: fantasy battles и dungeons and dragons, с явным «перекосом» в сторону первого (многие расы оттуда, начиная от 3-х рас эльфов, короля гномов, восседающего на троне, переносимого 4-мя оруженосцами с щитами, заканчивая (в кампании) противостоянием с королём чумы и нежитью, а также попыткой одолеть воинов хаоса, проникших в мир через портал на острове – чем не «кампания вихря» из total war:warhammer 2 2017 г. выпуска? Разумеется, лор вихря был задолго до warlords, но стиль кампании именно игры был применён  здесь, расцвет серии total war насупил несколько лет спустя). Иными словами, большая часть того, что сделало серию total war: warhammer воистину великой, зародилось в этой игре, за исключением поджанра – «боевой клич-3» относится к классическим rts. Только с выходом total war: warhammer 3 в конце 2021-начале 2022 г. появится стратегия, превосходящая по количеству рас обозреваемую игру. Однако, в отличие от  творений the creative assembly, warlords: battlecry 3 включала в себя все 16 рас сразу. 
От DnD досталась более обширная и гибкая система классов полководцев, а также очень мощная магия, особенно некромантия, которая впечатляет даже после существенного ослабления в последних патчах.
По иронии судьбы, только 18 марта 2021 г. в total war: warhammer 2 стало возможным официально (без модов) частично повторить  состав армии ящеролюдов из warlords: battlecry 3: тёмный эльф  Ракарт (дрессировщик зверей) может вести в бой  одновременно диких хладнокровных (местные ютарапторы),  рыцарей ужаса верхом на хладнокровных (рыцари тёмных эльфов), дикого стегадона (местный «гибрид анкилозавра и трицератопса»), дикого карнозавра (местный «гибрид мегараптора и тираннозавра рекса»), чёрных драконов, в то время как народ срасси знаменит  ящеролюдами верхом на ютарапторах, тираннозаврами, трицератопсами, драконами  и местным аналогом вавилонского сирруша в составе армии. 
Кампания довольно проста по содержанию, нов сё же включает несколько типов миссий (в до-стимовскую версию играл очень давно, точно помню режим сдерживания орд героем и отрядом, оборону столицы в стиле «почти  башенная защита» и классические миссии в стиле «схватка в warcraft 3»).
Рекомендую всем, кто интересуется старыми RTS в атмосфере классического средневекового fantasy,  желательно по скидке (149 р. – вполне приемлемая цена с учётом обширного контента, по полной цене может не оправдать себя у более молодых поколений игроков).

author: {'steamid': '76561198019785919', 'num_games_owned': 455, 'num_reviews': 41, 'playtime_forever': 94, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 56, 'last_played': 1616587746}
review:
Oh man,

I played this game probably 15 years ago. I remember seeing it on the shelves of EB Games and JB HI FI so much when it was released, i actually ended up with 3 physical copies from due to lost CD Keys and scratched discs. My dad used to let me bring home a game every once in a blue moon and i would select them based on how cool the covers were. I guess coincidentally all of them were RTS games lmao. I could probably find one if i went through all my old CDs.

I have no idea how much of this game i played back then, i couldn't fuckin' read and my most vivid memory was that my character's names were all "qwerty and "asdfgh". Kind of kid that ate crayons i was. The most ironic thing is that now i barely play the RTS genre and i'm not even any good at it despite spending most of my childhood glued to them.

But revisiting this for the sake of some nostalgia i've accidentally experienced this game for the first time properly, you know, being able to read and all. And its fantastic. I played a lot of RTS as a young child (StarCraft, Command & Conquer, WH40K, KKnD and TA. Never played AOE though ;) )

From what i can tell this game was a pretty good attempt at mixing an RPG with an RTS. You have a Hero character you start with and they have their own skills and stats, but then the rest of the game is an RTS. The campaign is pretty good and also like true old school RTS fashion, a bit difficult. 

The game runs okay on modern systems. The resolution is dogshit and alt tabbing in and out gives you graphical issues but so far no crashes and im able to play it just like i did back then.

If you're a fan of the RTS genre and want a bit of a divergence from the classic formula this is perfect, though a bit aged.

author: {'steamid': '76561198833661115', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 17, 'playtime_forever': 1333, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1333, 'last_played': 1574654907}
review:
it is a great game, most of the factions are fun to play(i just suck at the rest), i will say something about my favorite factions, the undead are one of my favorites, they only heal passively at night unlike the rest that heal passively all of the time but they heal twice as fast at night and one of the magic spells your heroes can cast turns it to nights(and with an upgrade at the undead's main building can spend resources to change it to night as well), the undead faction units upgrade from skeletons to almost every other unit they have using resources, the dark dwarfs are my second favorite due to one unit the iron golem, they might be my favorite unit in the game being able to hit every enemy around them both ground and air at the same time and tanky to boot but vary slow... so so slow... they have other units but most only hit ground making the iron golem one of the only anti air unit other then the ballista and wraith\shadows and units from the flying unit building all factions get, the fay are my favorite to play as, i play them more then any other race even though i like the undead faction's gimmick more, a swarm of sylphs destroying your enemies is funny as hell, spriggans are good to but unlike the destroyers know as sylph swarms can only attack ground units, oakmen are builder units that double as infantry, they are tanky but a little slow until the speed upgrade research, leprechauns give a small gold income for existing and are good renged units to put into towers to keep them safe, pixies are good ranged units but don't give gold but they do good damage, sprites are a ranged flying unit that is good in large numbers but can die really fast, unicorns are cav units that can heal, healing is vary important in this game since units can gain veterancy and become vary powerful, most units of the fay other then oakmen and unicorns are vary frail and can die fast, spriggans and sylphs can dodge attacks but can still die in 1-2 good hits, i love this game and could talk about almost every other race like this(except plaguelords i still don't know how to play them) but this is long enough as it is.

tl;dr fun rts 17 factions with little to no unit overlap, would recommend.

review: Se trata de un juego muy entretenido al estilo de un juego de estrategia de tiempo real con un héroe que puede ir subiendo de nivel en cada partida y adquiriendo nuevas habilidades. author: {'steamid': '76561198106132974', 'num_games_owned': 78, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 44381, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 36601, 'last_played': 1691121671}
review:
Like many others, this game was my childhood and i loved it... But fuck the screamer at the end of a defeat. The only reason i always resigned at the slightest hint of possible defeat was because that scared the shit out of me when i was little, even when my father told me it was deactivated i still didn't want to loose a match without resignation.

Still it's a great game for a low price and if you like it you should definitely consider downloading "The Protectors mod" it has more missions and the same campaign along with new ones, rebalanced units, more music instead of the same tiresome 7 tracks, revamped classes and new ones, better gaming mechanics and factions for each race.

Much thanks to the creators and the modders for giving me soo much entertainment in my past and present life.

author: {'steamid': '76561198993339237', 'num_games_owned': 45, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 9595, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6145, 'last_played': 1664354128}
review:
Впервые познакомилась с этой игрой ещё в подростковом возрасте, и она сразу покорила моё сердце. Уж не знаю чем - то ли магией, то ли сказочными существами, то ли драконами, то ли пикселями... Была рада узнать, что можно купить лицензионку в Стиме, но знаете, от старой игры на диске она ничем не отличается, разве что значок сделать можно. Если скачаете в интернете крякнутую версию за бесплатно - ничего не потеряете.
А так-то это определённо то, во что я никогда не устану играть. Много рас, классов и скиллов, разнообразие предметов и бонусов, приятная графика. Огорчает только очень небольшое кол-во реиграбельных квестов в кампании.

review: Gra w którą grałem za gówniaka i pierwsza gra która wymagała odemnie większego myślenia była wspaniała uwielbiałem ją w całości a jej grafika była czymś niedogonionym. Do momentu kiedy to mój komputer się zepsuł a ja nie pamiętałem nazwy tej gry co ciekawe tak bardzo mi się podobała że szukałem jej po samych obrazkach z gogle grafika czy też różnych topek gier roków tego rodzaju przez 12 lat aż wkońcu udało mi się ją znaleźć uwielbiam te grę lecz mimo tego że nie mam masy czasu aby się w niej zatopić czuję się bezpieczniej gdy mam ją w swojej bibliotece . Polecam grę każdemu jest wspaniała ❤️🔥 powoli moje godziny rosną a ja wciąż czuję się jak ten młody chłopak który spędzał przy tym wieczory !

author: {'steamid': '76561198100716944', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 20, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 20, 'last_played': 1605898722}
review:
I'll start by saing that this game is on of the best RTS ever made: lots of races, buildings, units, classes and replayability. The main problem is that the STEAM version does not provide any multiplayer service: you still have to figure out how to play (only with people you know) through virtual LAN software such as Hamachi or Gameranger.
It's much easier to manage the game if you get the installer on GOG, at least you don't have to use STEAM to play it (since it's useless anyway in this case).

author: {'steamid': '76561198008936476', 'num_games_owned': 1000, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 501, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 501, 'last_played': 1561619277}
review:
Before I begin, I just want to say that there's a free, Stand Alone mod for This game Called The Protectors, The team for that mod is currently active (At the time of this review) And have Improved...EVERYTHING!!! about it. Including adding new classes, Sub Factions for every race, New Stories and Campaigns and more. Plus you don't need to own This game to play it. But I highly Recommend you do and here's why

Warlords Battlecry 3 Combines Elements of both RTS Games like Warcraft 3 and Command & Conquer. With ARPG Elements of games like Diablo and Dungeon Siege to name a few. The RTS Side has you picking from 16 different races/factions, Capturing Mines to build up a base and an army, Research tech and higher tiers. Then going out to crush your enemies. And the ARPG Side has you control a hero that's like a Hero Unit from WC3. They gain XP and level up with each mission/quest/match you play. They earn points that you can put into spells and passive perks. And you can collect pieces of gear off of boss like enemies, Finding Treasure Chests and killing enemy heroes (Note that all gear comes from Treasure Chests In the actual game maps and such) 

Like I said, There are 16 Different Races you can pick from and play, Each having the same ways to get higher tiers but each having their own play-styles, Strengths and weaknesses. For an example, The Fay or Or Fairies. Are the weakest in terms of Health and Defence, But they make up for it by being a Swarm like race, Able to product an army at an alarming pace and also having extremely fast moving units in both movement and attack speed. And the Minotaurs, They have the smallest amount of units in the game, But they make it up for it by having a lot of upgrades for their units. Every unit in the game has a different attack like, Like the Orcs Ogre unit has a big club so it does crushing damage, Attacks can also Critically strike which dose an effect depending on the attack, Crushing can stun targets, While Piercing Ignores armour. Units can also have weaknesses to different attack types, Like an example. A skeleton is weak to Crushing damage, While a Stone Golem is weak to Lighting based attacks 

Before you begin to play, You will be asked to create a hero, While the creator is very basic In terms of what you can do you. You can do any race/class combo you want So if you wanted a Demon to be a paladin or a Human Knight be a Summoner of demons then you can do that. Perhaps you want a Dwarf Druid or a Elf Runemaster, That's possible. Your hero is very Important, Depending on the game mode/rules, You start off with nothing besides your hero and Maybe a couple of towers depending on the map. Your hero has a few abilities besides the class spells (Because of course a Ice Mage will have Ice Spells or a Necromancer can raise the dead) For one, Your hero is a builder so you want to quickly plop down your races HQ. Second, Your hero (And other higher tier units) Has a Convert ability. Again, Depending on the map. There are 4 main resources, Gold, Iron, Stone and Crystal. Each having 3 levels. The Difference Between the levels is that the lowest can hold up to 5000 while the highest can hold 150000. Converting makes your hero stand in place and do a channel, Then once it's finished you own the building, You can do this with enemy buildings as well. 

The campaign has an "Open world" location to location system, where you can travel around the world to different spots on the map. You first need to do the main quest in a set area before you can explore the wider world but it shouldn't take too long to finish There are two kinds of missions. Regular/Main Quests that you can only do once, And Repeating Quests that can be on randomly generated maps (More on that soon) The only down side is that while you travel, you will be ambushed, Think of it like Final Fantasy Encounters, You can defend your self with an army you can prepare before, While others are just unfair (!#$%y !#$%Ing Griffons...). Of course doing these missions will make your hero level up but also your units can as well. When you finish a mission there might be a chance of you getting a named Secondary Character to join you, Think of these like the Honor Guard In dawn of war Dark Crusade/Soul Storm. At first they are nothing more then a higher level basic troop, But if you baby them and take good care, They can be beasts. But sadly, Once they die. They are Dead for good

The Skirmish is one of the best I've ever played in an RTS, Not only can you tweak a lot of rules and also change the game mode, But you can also play on a randomly generated map, Pick the Biome, The amount of resources, The amount of hostile camps (There can be hostile camps that spawn wandering enemy units that can attack anyone) and more. And of course there's an Editor much like Warcraft 3. It won't let you create the next DOTA but it does have the tools to make something grand...And to be honest...I'm one of those folks that will make a XP Farm, Have my self a fortress of 100 titans (The Ultimate Unit of every faction) Have 500 towers, 1000 shops so I can get gear for my hero. Then once I felt like it's time, Send my Army of Titans to crush everyone. 

I highly recommend picking up the series on GOG (Or this version on steam) While It is true there is a Stand Alone Mod called The Protectors. I'm sure there are some folks that, Despite there being a Remaster or Remake. They would prefer to grab, lets say a PS1, Find all of the bits for it and play the classic original version of the game they grew up with. There's also a few mods and Unofficial patches for the retail version of WBC3 such as The 1.03.5 Mod Or The Widescreen Patch 1.04b2.

author: {'steamid': '76561198096738296', 'num_games_owned': 11, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 88165, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 793, 'last_played': 1710551068}
review:
Este videojuego tiene una gran variedad de razas, especialidades y características que hacen a nuestro héroe único, tiene una historia bastante decente con un modo historia muy bien logrado y con muchas de cosas por hacer, me gusta que hay muchas formas de subir de nivel y que tanto la experiencia de la historia como del modo normal ayuda aún más a nuestro personaje, es divertido, me encanta la música del juego y es uno de mis videojuegos favoritos, aunque debo decir que ha envejecido mucho, que hay ciertos errores presentes y es un videojuego donde debes tener mucha paciencia.
Lo recomiendo a todos aquellos que les guste los RPG, los juegos de estrategia, los juegos de fantasía o medievales y a los aficionados de las historias complejas.

author: {'steamid': '76561198037427689', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 141, 'playtime_forever': 93, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 93, 'last_played': 1600220066}
review: EDIT:Steam won't let me format the review so a big wall of text is what you get lmaoThis is a game that is a poster boy for rose tinted glasses. I used to play the shit out of the demo of this game as a kid via mofunzone demos until I finally got to play the full game through... certain methods. Early 2000s were a great time for me as a kid. However, this game doesn't hold up today. Without going into too much rant-flavoured detail, it's just not a very balanced game overall for an RTS. I played a few battles and had a really tough time winning any of them(aside from the first two sundered isle battles you can do, those are easy), even after the game asked me to set the difficulty to easy, which it does every single time you lose, even if you're already on easy. Didn't care to try and force my way through tedious RTS gameplay.Maybe I crippled myself by choosing Wood Elves as my race(elves suck in this game, choose empire or knights for a beginner race because at least their units aren't balloons ready to pop), as well as choosing a magic-focused class, but I wanted to try something new. Honestly, I remember it being a lot easier but I suppose it applies mostly to late-game. You can solo groups of enemies with just your hero by then. The game is very dependent on the hero mechanics for this reason. Your hero can become down right OP even starting at mid-game. Early game, though, this game is hell. Your hero dies very quickly and you really have to turtle yourself to build up your armies. The enemy AI within minutes into the game will suicide its way into your base(IIRC all battles start you with towers + the main building) so you can hang back, build up your forces and then just push your way through the map.One big issue with this game compared to others is that it's very clunky. You can't move-attack(like in the Warcraft games, where your units move to the spot and attack anything on the way) but you can set your units to relentless, where they wander the map randomly and fight anything they come across. Randomly is the key word here because they'll spread out and not stick together unless by luck, and no units in this game can really solo aside from the 'ultimate' unit and maybe the advanced/elite units but even then they get taken down by groups easily. There's other unit modes like relentless but they're all really not great. The interface isn't very good and holy shit clicking on moving units is the worst. You also can only select a certain number of units at a time so if you have a big army you have to go back and forth to select your army over and over. There's one mission where you have to defeat a large enemy army and it's pretty difficult to kill them before they move past the walls because you can't move all units at the same time.The research system for all races is very shallow. It mostly boils down to unlocking new units, stat upgrades for certain units, and resource/unit upgrades e.g. greater HP regen. The selection of buildings has the same issue and some buildings are just redundant/useless but some do have passive bonuses.The game's campaign is comprised of spots on the map that you can travel between to do unique, and replayable, battles to progress the story and get items or money. Honestly, it is very mundane. It's cool to go to different areas and fight different enemies in different scenarios but wow it gets boring very quickly because it's the same stuff over and over and it's not a short campaign either. I suppose that's RTS for you, though.Another review recommended The Protectors mod. I don't recommend it at all. It's broken, it has an unfinished campaign that lasts about 10-20 minutes and it crashed when I tried to load one of the available mini-campaigns. It does have more customisation and text-adventure choice making but it isn't even close to completion. I'm pretty sure it's abandoned too.Rose tinted glasses is my summary of this game. I have no idea how I spent so much time on this game as a kid, let alone the demo for it. I suppose it might get better late-game but this is a very bottom-of-the-barrel RTS and there's tons of better RTS games out there. This game doesn't have any special features that make it a better pick over other better RTS.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052327318', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 3798, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 5, 'playtime_at_review': 1292, 'last_played': 1712365463}
review: Ive played Warlords Battlecry II and III. This game is a hero-based RTS, with lots of factions and an unusual sense of balance. Depending on how you like  to play, one race is going to be better or worse than others, so you won't always have the easiest game. Heroes are super flexible and have a decent depth for builds. There are some flaws and the graphics are a bit dated, but if you can play this game, you definitely should. The box says I spent 21 hours, but I know I've spent more than triple that over the years. Skirmishes are good for getting a hero up to par so you can conquer the campaign!

author: {'steamid': '76561198088103020', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 2518, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2274, 'last_played': 1623898215}
review:
I used to play this back between 2001-2009. I wish RTS games would adapt the same concept where you can level up your Hero and still use the same character in both Skirmish and Campaign; it doesn't let your effort go to waste. It's an old game, yes, but with a variety of classes/races available in-game, it will definitely be worth your time. 

I'm already level 63 with my Necromancer Undead Hero and I'm still getting tons of fun despite dying waaaay too much.

author: {'steamid': '76561198055984402', 'num_games_owned': 55, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 2503, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2304, 'last_played': 1689984660}
review:
When I was a Child my uncle introduced me to this game. I immediately was hooked onto it because of the aspect of dark fantasy, Real time strategy. The countless of combinations of classes and races is a plus because you can be any race with any class.
 The campaign mode is very interesting and worth while to do. The skirmish mode which i always play on is one of the best ways for you to choose and pratice against any race/class/difficulty/maps.
   The only downside is multiplayer does not work problably due to the game being old and servers are not operating.
 My rating of this game would be 9.5/10 stars.

author: {'steamid': '76561198016330015', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 602, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 517, 'last_played': 1671291281}
review: Это нечто олдскульное и без крутой графики, но тем не менее все остальное на месте. Классный сюжет, разнообразие в выборе рас и классов, юниты отличаются у всех, проработанно все до мелочей. А также ролевая система, которую можно сравнить NWN (конечно уступает неверу, но это стратегия, задумайтесь).

author: {'steamid': '76561198030337222', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 13, 'playtime_forever': 8612, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4066, 'last_played': 1710574102}
review:
An excellent game, just as I remember. With one caveat.

THE RNG ACTUALLY WORKS

Anyone who had this game on disc way back before Steam was a thing probably had the same problem my brother and I did. The game didn't *do* what it said it would. Because the RNG was broken. As a result, the only items you'd get outside the campaign were 'Elven Ring of Greed' and 'Plaguesword'. Also, you  couldn't cast magic unless you were AT 100 percent chance of casting. With this copy? All that's no longer a problem!

I can cast magic at whatever percentage. Poison works. Disease works. Assassination works (God help me on that one) and items are fully randomised from the ENTIRE ITEM LIST! It's excellent! And, as well as that, my scouts no longer just head to one corner of the map and then Blair Witch against the limits of the map! Which is excellent as well.

Well worth the money, well worth investing time into, well worth it full stop.

author: {'steamid': '76561198269136639', 'num_games_owned': 384, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 506, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 497, 'last_played': 1666253889}
review:
[b]Лучшая RTS всех времен и народов.[/b] Познакомился с этой серией игр в далеком 2004 и до сих пор периодически возвращаюсь в неизменный мир Этерии холодными вечерами. 
К несомненным плюсам WBC3 можно отнести богатый выбор рас, классов, потрясающий рисованный визуал, атмосферную музыку, а также возможность создания своего альтер эго, руководящего армией на поле брани. Вы можете создать орка-паладина, эльфа-чернокнижника, рептилоида-драконоборца и не только! Главная фича игровой механики – класс и раса героя, сильно влияющие на общую используемую стратегию: вряд ли торговец будет стремиться идти в бой в первых рядах, а воин прятаться в башне. Все возможные связки позволят вам нащупать свой собственный стиль игры, но перед тем, как это случится, может пройти не один десяток часов. 
Все-таки у WBC3 порог вхождения чуть выше среднего, нельзя сказать, что игра очень сложная. Но во многом она устарела, и я даже не про графику. Это может отпугнуть новых игроков. Хотя, эта часть сделана по-настоящему user-friendly и ее можно рекомендовать для первого знакомства с серией.

[b]P.S.[/b] Тем, кого отпугивают старые механики, я рекомендую посмотреть современный и до сих пор обновляемый мод The Protectors, который добавляет новые игровые фишки, делающие игру по-настоящему сбалансированной и современной. Единственный минус – пока отсутствует поддержка кириллицы и русского перевода.

author: {'steamid': '76561198046040233', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 31, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 31, 'last_played': 1588009589}
review:
Je recommande le jeu, mais pas sur Steam, sur GOG plutôt. J'ai joué a ce jeu avec de nombreux exploitants et celui-là sort des truc bizarres comme le nid au niveau 2 de QG ou des invocations limités par le temps, alors que dans les bonnes versions elles n'ont pas ces paramètres farfelues qui change l'équilibre du jeu. Je vois beaucoup de "le jeu de mon enfance" ou "la nostalgie", mais faut croire qu'il ne faut pas s'y fier...à ce dont il se souviennent j'entends. 

J'ai acheté sur Steam en pensant que c'était la même que la version officielle et je me suis trompé. Je ne regretterai jamais d'avoir acheter ce jeu, mais celle-là semble naze.

Prenez la sur GOG.

J'ai fait une vidéo dessus il y a un temps déjà : https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=I8tsqVimxeM&t=5s

author: {'steamid': '76561199007782162', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 3635, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2620, 'last_played': 1616759559}
review:
Jest to fanowska wersja tej gry która ma wiele różnić
1) wysokie elfy mają inną grafikę struktur 
2) jednostki maja zmienioną cenę / surowiec / czy ma zmienioną cenę z surowcami
Minusy
1) zmieniono system wydawania punków umiejętności: oryginał: wystarczy mieć ZDOBYTE 10 punktów by mieć nową umiejętność do wydawania. w tej trzeba mieć WYDANE 10 punktów by mieć nową umiejętność do wydawania.
2) po zakończeniu każdej misji zwykłym bohaterem można przyłączyć do swojej ,,świty" (miejsce na jednostki które można użyć na początku innej rozgrywki) : oryginał na start ma się odblokowane 3 miejsca ,,świty" i jak się chce więcej miejsc trzeba wydawać punkty poziomu w ,,charyzmę" na odpowiedni poziom. tu ma się na początku odblokowane wszystkie miejsca i przez to jest za łatwo .
3) Bohater może rzucać zaklęcia które może odblokować przypisane mu dziedziny np. : przywołania, nekromancji ... i w tych 2 można przywołać demony lub zombie, szkielety. Oryginale: przywołane istoty nie znikną po czasie.
Ta. przywołane istoty nad sobą mają pomarańczowy pasek który robi się jaśniejszy i kiedy dojdzie do końca jednostka znika. Jak ze ,,świtą" to niszczy wiele taktyk polegających na przywoływaniu armię demonów lub szkieletów w bazie, by nie narażać bohatera na śmierć, by wesprzeć armię tylko trzeba pilnować bohatera by go przeciwnik nie zabił gdy on za blisko nie podejdzie, a strata bohatera jest odczuwalna czyli: droższe ceny jednostek budynków i niższe statystyki jednostek.
4) często wyrzuca z gry.
5) na początku każdej walki dostaję się punkty za które można kupić startowe jednostki: budowniczych, żołnierzy, kawalerie z danej rasy lub jednostkę z ,,świty". Ów grze jest mechanika którą zwiększa ilość punktów przez poziom bohatera.  Gdy ustawi się 5 punktów domyślnie do rozdania . 37 poziom otrzymuje się 8 punktów na start. 13 poziom otrzymuje się 6 punktów na start. Jeśli się gra własnymi Bohaterami i występuje większa różnica poziomów to gracz który ma większy poziom ma więcej punktów na start więc może na start mieć dodatkowego budowniczego czy żołnierza.
6) ta gra fanowska wersja nie dostaje aktualizacje i lepiej jest wejść na forum społecznościowe o tej grze i pobrać z netu grę i patch'e którzy fani tej gry wysyłają i balansują rasy i jednostki by każda w 1vs1 miały szanse.

author: {'steamid': '76561198047662972', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 8293, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 4341, 'last_played': 1705339612}
review:
Excellent jeu STR/RPG où vous pouvez construire des bases, convertir des mines pour avoir toujours plus de ressources (utilisables pour les bâtiments, unités, améliorations), remplir des quêtes pour des bonus.

Il y a un vaste choix de races, allant de races humaines comme les chevaliers et l'Empire, aux nains, aux différentes races d'elfes, les orcs, les morts-vivants, des hommes lézards, des démons, etc...
Un système d'escarmouche qui permet au jeu d'avoir une grosse durée de vie.
Une campagne très sympathique avec de bons éléments de gameplays.
Ambiance sonore excellente que ça soit la musique, les bruitages ou même les voicelines.

Les seuls reproches que j'ai à faire à cette version Steam, c'est l'absence des voix françaises (la VF était excellente mais la VO aussi fait très bien le café) et peut être quelques problèmes d'équilibrages (même si des choses ont été faites pour essayer de régler ça), exemple, la Nécromancie est OP quand on la pousse à fond.

Bref, si vous cherchez un bon jeu de stratégie dans un monde fantasy/dark fantasy avec un grand panel de choix au niveau de race, un gameplay simple mais efficace. Vous pouvez clairement jouer à Warlords Battlecry 3.

author: {'steamid': '76561198041336230', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 34189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17773, 'last_played': 1702728384}
review:
Чудесная игра. Помню играл в нее с удовольствием еще как она появилась на полках. Одна из самых продвинутых, идейных и атмосферных стратегий тех лет (сейчас такое редко можно встретить). Как купил ее в Стиме снова потерялся в ней на пару недель. Единственное что остается лежкой дегтя в этой бочке меда так это баги и вылеты, а также некоторые неудобства в интерфейсе которые так и не убрали (например все время открывающийся инвентарь когда герой стоит на предмете - пережиток прошлого). Хотя были патчи.

Плюсы:
- Атмосферность мира игры
- Художественный арт, много арта)
- Прекрасная музыкальное сопровождение
- 16! игровых рас, со своими особенностями и плюшками
- 13! школ заклинаний
- Необычные сочетания рас и классов (Фея убийца или Демон Паладин)
- Безумие творится на игровой карте с +50 уровня героев
- Почти нелимитированная прокачка героев - слышал о героях 170го уровня кто-то качал
- Возможность играть на бесконечных картах после прохождения компании
- Смертные герои в режиме Iron Man (особенно понравился данный режим)
Минусы:
- Много багов:
    Вылеты на рабочий стол при чтении заклинаний
    Вылеты на рабочий стол при создании случайных карт (в том числе и компаниях)
    Индикатор отката заклинаний и призванных юнитов виден через интерфейс (видимо добавляли в спешке)
    Потеря героев (Iron Man) навсегда при некоторых падениях игры
    Кривоватое сохранение (сброс модификаций юнитов и героев например школой Хаоса при загрузке игры, или когда вызванные юниты становятся вечными)
- Отсутствие официальной русской локализации для версии Стима (русификатор староват и не весь контент переведен)
- Дисбаланс классов и рас. Общий дисбаланс игровой механики - хотя кому-то будет интересно играть слабыми классами и расами против сильных. Наверно в этом фишка старых игр.
- Отсутствие артефактов на уровни +50, артефактов на героя вообще мало и лишь на 1/4 всех рас они были сделаны.

Эта игра - классика. Причем хорошая, как раньше делались игры. Вроде как на нее еще существуют моды добавляющие всякое Full HD и причесывающие баланс. Однако люблю ее такой какая она есть.

П.С, Только в Warlords Battelcry III ты в ужасе прячешься в башню при наступлинии полчищ Темных Эльфов или Минатавров молясь чтоб какой-нибудь убийца или гнолл не добрался до твоего Iron Man (персонажа с 1й жизнью) и не послал нафиг твои 2-3 недели игры)  

В целом  8 вызванных демонов из 10, за выслугу лет и за то что игра все же издалась в Стиме - не мучаться теперь со старфорджем ^_^

author: {'steamid': '76561197999479652', 'num_games_owned': 444, 'num_reviews': 69, 'playtime_forever': 1424, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 779, 'last_played': 1584395970}
review:
Are you freaking kiddin me? Write a review of a game that is The Game?
Warlords were already out of place and I was out of mind, with it's peak Warlrods 3.
Then Warlords Battlecry 1 came, and was improved up to WBC 3, this game to maximum superiority. 
WBC 3 never needed any microtransactions, no gambling elements, no paid video streamers or false marketing / advertisement.
It was just one perfect game, with unbelievable replayability ratio. Well, many multiplayer games do have this ratio high, but the skill trees, spells, development and improvement paths, on top of the seemingly countless strategies offered, map editor, huge campaign and nearly hundred of unique units spread across dozen of factions.

This game should be taught in schools, there should be UNI major on this freaking game, FFS.

You don't buy this game, you lose!

review: The Warlords Battlecry franchise is a staple of my childhood and my intro to rts games. A very unique style where your hero can truly be, your hero. The many races and hero's to choose from leads to many different strategic outcomes. I strongly recommend this franchise to anyone. Although Battlecry 3 is the worst of the series, it is still a great and entertaining game that still carries most of the good qualities of the entire franchise. I just wish they had Battlecry 2 on Steam.
