author: {'steamid': '76561198079081172', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1051, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 886, 'last_played': 1454402064}
review:
This brings back memories.

I never got to play Warlords Battlecry 3, but I did play the first one extensively when I was a little kid. I enjoyed the combat mechanics to a degree and loved the idea of retaining troops and a hero after each map. This game brings more of the same and then some. That is to say, the same sprites that were used in the first and second games make an appearance here in the third game as well. 

The leveling mechanic in Warlords Battlecry 3 is done right. Your hero gains experience as the match goes on and can even level during the match (something that could not be done in the first one). Tons of classes and races allow for moderate choices which can dramatically alter your game play.

The varying abilities that are available for warlords to take can alter everything. Abilities like Engineer make your building have more hp (think tower defense), while merchant lowers the price of all units universally (good for swarm tactics). Abilities like constitution make warrior warlords a pain, while specific classes such as pyromancy can make enemy warlords dangerous. A well built warlord can take down an army in the blink of an eye, as long you carefully watch the battle unfold.

If the Hero concept does not sell the game to you, then maybe the races will. There are 16 different races, each with unique troops and abilities to really add variety and replayability. Although some units are shared by races, you'll be impressed with the selection given here! To add to this, each race has a unique titan that can really change the tide of battle. 

Titans are units that can only be built near end match when most upgrades have been researched. After it is available, it takes a while to build and if it dies, its gone for the match. However, Titans can mow down armies without flinching, provided they don't get overwhelmed! (If you don't like this concept there is an option to turn this off, but why would you?)

Finally, the campaign is truly something to behold. Loads of side missions and ambushes add for a significant amount of reputability. The mainline of the campaign is not all that exciting and ends quickly but the significant amount of side mission will more than make up for the weakness of the mainline in the campaign. The missions are also quite varied too. Tournament pitting you Warlord vs others as well as defense missions and elimination missions leave the campaign quite varied.

Although my overall view of this game is highly positive, I would be boldly lying if I did not say there were problems with the game as well. Bugs that were very annoying in the first game have made a return here. I experienced an average of "1 crash every hour", but most came from multiplayer. I am unsure if what was causing the issues but it was a problem for both Windows 8 and 10. Low max resolution can be a little annoying to some as well (although it didn't bother me at all).

The most important problem by far though is the AI in Warlords Battlecry series. Sometimes you will start a match and the AI will be vicious. They will quickly swarm you and be relentless for quite some time, even on easy difficulty. This can be fun at times but frustrating as well. Other times, The AI will suddenly refuse to continue on and just give up or make baffling mistakes. I watched the AI walk a Titan into a field of towers and let it die. Afterwards, maybe 10 minutes later, it brought an army that wiped the board in seconds without losing many casualties. The AI also makes VERY bad decisions with their Warlords which will handicap them (but to a lesser extent). Suffice it to say that the AI is definitely passable and a capable challenge, but could benefit from a little work.


The good

+ Warlords
+ Retinue of generals
+ Loads of varying Classes
+ Loads of different Races
+ Titans add a new level of combat
+ More fleshed out mechanics
+ Building art style is nice
+ Soundtrack is decent (and easily modifiable if you want to make a custom soundtrack)


The Bad
- Still filled with some annoying bugs
- Crashes are horribly common (I would go hours without having one, then have 3 in 10 minutes)
- Random AI can sometimes be REALLY hard or REALLY easy.
- At times, maps are not optimized for the AI to understand. (Some maps cause the AI to become brain dead)
- Max resolution is 1280x1024 (which you get used to quickly but still should have higher resolution available)
- The fan made patches for this game are forcefully implemented here. (It is obvious that Steam and GOG did not spend any time playing the game as one mod adds a silly profane comment when building conversion occurs.) This is not a deal breaker, especially with this game, but I hate when stuff like this happens. I want the option to mod me vanilla game, not be given a premoded version.


Overall, I give this game a 9/10 and recommend it for Warlords series fans. Its a good strategy game for anyone but its massive compilation of Warlords units (especially from Warlords 4) was awesome. This game is rough around the edges and some support would really help smooth out the problems. None of the problems I encountered were ever bad enough to make me upset with the game. If you're thinking about this, give it a go!

author: {'steamid': '76561197961537602', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1454114412}
review:
I loved playing this game as a child, but unfortunately this is a terrible port.  I had to jump through so many hoops(running in compatibility mode, changing resolutions, using older drivers, etc) that its ridiculous.  After finally getting the game to run it crashes periodically during certain screens (campaign map, leveling up, cut scenes).  Also, having to downgrade to the original game since it ships with an fan made patch(yes, I understand the developers approved this patch but it is not the game I was expecting when I purchased).

Overall I cannot recommend this game in its current form.  Maybe I will repurchase it if the developers decide to fix some of the many problems.

author: {'steamid': '76561198001784686', 'num_games_owned': 951, 'num_reviews': 111, 'playtime_forever': 14272, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 9870, 'last_played': 1704095559}
review:
I love it. It's the same as it always was so if you liked it before you'll still like it. The old problems are still here, group pathing sucks, speeding the game up seems to help with the pathing, I had some crashes trying to play ironman but none playing normal. If you've never played it and you like strategy games then I highly recommend this one. The graphics are lacking but there are tons of races/classes, 100's of spells, hundreds of items if not thousands :p  Fans of this might also want to check out Heroes of Annilated Empires, there are some similarities but this game has way more options.

VERY IMPORTANT - anyone that buys this, especially if you didn't play it in the past, I found a game manual free download here http://www.replacementdocs.com/download.php?view.1624 It's a 88 page manual just to give you an idea of how much depth there is in this little treasure. The manual helped me greatly and I played 100's of hours in the past. Dev/publisher/whoever should really put a link on the store page for it.. If you're on the fence about buying it check out the manual and I bet that you end up giving the game a try.

I'm so happy that this was added to steam. Add some cards and achievements next ;)

I just nominated it for "The Best Use of Farm Animals" award!

author: {'steamid': '76561197995265925', 'num_games_owned': 624, 'num_reviews': 16, 'playtime_forever': 123, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 10, 'last_played': 1691257620}
review:
-------------------------------------------
[h1] How to run on modern systems [/h1]
-------------------------------------------
I recommend checking out The Protectors modpack or the community Widescreen Patch 1.04b2

You can find how to run it here: http://the-protectors.forumotion.com/t352-how-to-run-wbc-series-stably-on-modern-setups

And the patch here: https://etheria.fandom.com/wiki/Patch_Downloads

-------------------------------------------
[h1] The Review [/h1]
-------------------------------------------

This is a fantastic real-time strategy game that I have sunk many hours into before this Steam release. It's extremely challenging when you want it to be or a cake walk if you don't feel like trying to hard. The game itself has plenty of personality, fun sound effects and satisfying feeling of being able to primarily focus on your army.

Positives:
- RPG Hero System
- Huge Battles & Maps
- Fun campaign with excellent flavour from the story
- 16 different races to choose from over your standard 2-3 other RTS' at the time offered.
- 28 different hero classes

Negatives (99% due to age):
- It's age holds it back meaning resolution is lower and no where near compatible with widescreen. The game itself works fine, just stretches the image or provides you with black bars.
- Crashes when the battles get too intense
- Multiplayer can be a bit finicky to get working with the constant need to restart the game after each match and occassional crashes during it. 


I highly recommend The Protectors Mod as this provides huge amounts of functionality in regards to updating the old system to support higher resolutions, more units and a magnitude of other features.
https://www.moddb.com/games/the-protectors

author: {'steamid': '76561198035874665', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 12305, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1706345485}
review:
[h1]A powerful addiction of heroic role-playing meets old school strategic gameplay that rarely fails to surprise.[/h1]

There are many reasons as to why Warlords Battlecry III failed to set the world on fire, but if you look hard enough, you'll find one of the most dedicated and passionate fan bases in computer gaming today; a community that, like myself, just can't seem to put this excellent game down.

Battlecry III is a cult favourite then, a title with an enduring legacy that fans have continued to support over the years with a wealth of quality mods, maps, and patches that either improve, enhance and otherwise expand this wonderful blend of heroic fantasy and real-time strategy. 

As an RTS, Battlecry III is both original and familiar. Usually you'll start by exploring the map and guiding your hero unit to resource mines that he/she/it can convert to your side and choke points that need to be guarded against enemy scouts. 

Meanwhile you'll have your worker units busily constructing a base and once those precious resources of gold, metal, ore and crystal start to pour in, it's time to produce new units and upgrades that will strengthen your chosen plan of attack. 

Before you can take part in this skirmish however you need to create your own hero and here is where the fun really begins. Battlecry III makes one crucial change over its prequel; a change that improves the overall game significantly. 

Unlike Battlecry II, where heroes developed down a more stringent path, Battlecry III streamlines every heroic class and allows you to experiment with each one right from the beginning. 

Sure, it may not be the best idea to create a charisma-starved undead merchant, but the game isn't going to stop you from trying it! Maybe you like the idea of creating a noble knight who practices the dark arts of necromancy? Or a wood elf who summons demons? Perhaps a plaguelord alchemist? A dwarven healer? Or an orcish paladin? 

The combinations are truly endless and with 16 different races, 29 heroic classes and even more skills, weapons and experience points to gather, you're bound to find something here that suits your preferred play style.

Battlecry III is made even more memorable by its charming sense of humour and rather old school isometric 3D graphics. Each battlefield unit has plenty of fun sound files and animations that makes for many a colourful confrontation loaded with more personality than a dozen similar titles I've played over the years. 

The majority of this characterization comes from the contrast between the good, neutral and evil races; something that is amusingly highlighted when their respective units are clicked in-game. "The age of heroes has ended!" yells the dark rider, "buttercups and rainbows!" squeaks the diminutive fey sprite, and "when is dinner?" inquires the oafish orc giant. 

The main campaign mode is made more interesting this time around too with a dedicated storyline accompanying your conquests across the land of Etheria and a developing narrative that explores your hero's effort to seal away Gorgon; the feared fifth horseman of ancient legend. 

It's here though that you start to recognize the one thing that's really holding Battlecry III back; its budget. It's clear that the creators put a lot of love into this game, but as reviewers pointed out at the time, there are several aspects that feel a bit underdeveloped and old-hat; no doubt a symptom of time and budgetary constraints during its production. 

There is a raft of missing content from Battlecry II for one, including unit sound effects, quests (in-game challenges that crop up from shrines) and certain scripts for hero builds and AI behaviour. Whilst graphically the game looks more detailed than Battlecry II, it's a shame that some of the second game's vibrant colour has been lost during the transition. 

Also upsetting is the amount of bugs, balance concerns and the shoddy net code that is terribly unfit for purpose. Battlecry III is a great game to play with friends, no doubt about it, but good luck getting your session to sync up correctly first time. 

Getting back to the point I made about the story; it's also a shame that the final campaign mission doesn't feature a final showdown with Gorgon himself, as you merely fight his minions in a gauntlet-style survival encounter whilst an anti-climatic timer ticks along in the corner. 

At many of these points you get the feeling that the developer's time and money simply ran out, leaving the game in a disappointing state of 'almost there'. 

Luckily the fan community for Battlecry III has gone well beyond the call of duty with several talented members continuing to improve the game with both Infinite Interactive's blessing and their assistance. 

Armed with a portion of the game's source code, a dedicated cult of modders have gone on to create brand new patches that fix bugs, balance units and in some cases add completely new content such as a summoning timer and the awesome monk hero class. 

Without these community patches Battlecry III would be a much harder sell and it really speaks volumes about the raw passion and energy that has gone into these fan-made enhancement projects. 

(Pro tip for new players:- the [b]Vampirism[/b] skill does not function in the 1.03.24, build so bear this in mind when building a character!) 

Another reason I have continued to appreciate this title over the years is my belief in this truly being a game without boundaries. 

When it comes to heroes for example, there's no level cap and therefore no limit to how absurdly powerful your favourite little avatar can become. 

If you truly are dedicated enough to make it past level 100 then expect to see the game balance busted wide open as your epic hero reigns death upon your enemies with lightening fast attacks, devastating spells and a heavily discounted legion of augmented troops. 

Once again, it may be a little crazy, but the game isn't going stop you from trying it, because if it's fun, what else really matters? Admiteddly, there is a lot standing in the way of Warlords Battlecry III being any good. 

The art style looks dated, the netcode is barely there and it’s blessed with more than its fair share of bugs and balance concerns. 

Nevertheless, this is a game that will suck you in for hours at a time and truly astonish you with its replayability, sense of humour and irresistible marriage of strategy and open-ended RPG elements. 

A sketchy work of pure brilliance. 

[url=http://www.celjaded.com/celjaded-top-100-best-video-games-7/]Read the full retrospective at my blog »[/url]

author: {'steamid': '76561198164627452', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 5322, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 131, 'last_played': 1709944483}
review:
Warlords series was one of those games my dad bought for me cause he couldn't find Warcraft. It was part of a small set of Warlords 4: Heroes of Etheria, Warlords Battlecry 2, Age of Empires 2 and Conqueror's Expansion Gold Edition, and several other games I couldn't even play.

What I have to say is my dad had awesome luck. The battlecry series was amazing, and 3 was just a higher grade expanded version of 2. More races, more magic, same awesome battles.

I'm honestly too much of a wimp to play this on hard until I beat the damn campaign, but watch. I'll actually do so soon enough...

author: {'steamid': '76561197998482723', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 11, 'playtime_forever': 6, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 6, 'last_played': 1453781724}
review:
The original game is great and a lot of fun, but it is dated and this release has not been updated from earlier versions. I tried to get it to run properly for a couple hours and just kept running into technical issues, flashing cursor, black screen after coming back from alt-tabbing, broken multiplayer. 

If the folks releasing this actually did some work to get this game running properly on modern machines and got multiplayer running through Steamworks, or got it working at all this would be easy to recommend, but as a long time fan of the series I can't recommend this release due to all the annoyances and headaches associated with this game on newer machines. 

Great game, in desperate need of an update. Pick it up if you don't mind playing single player and living with an unstable game, otherwise avoid.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039166993', 'num_games_owned': 1182, 'num_reviews': 2, 'playtime_forever': 538, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 37, 'last_played': 1677339030}
review:
This is one of my favorite games of all time. Even today Warlords Battlecry 3 has a lot to offer to the real time strategy genre, even if at moments the implementation is a little sloppy. It has a ton of races to choose from, and a persistent hero unit you can bring from game to game as well as units you can level up and put into your retinue to also bring from game to game(if they die they are dead forever though, unlike your hero unless you choose ironman mode). The graphics haven't aged very well but it is still an extremely fun experience for anyone who has not played it before.
Edit: I have played this game for hundreds of hours during my childhood, i have played much longer then 30 minutes.

author: {'steamid': '76561198053058189', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 62, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 28, 'last_played': 1509350324}
review:
Rating system
There are 5 grades of quality for me

5 Good the people have actually taken their time to do things well
4 Cheap meaning lacking in some areas that could have major improvements
3 Fast referring to a buggy or poorly run game
2 Half-arsed made for the sole purpose of maximizing profits, business that developed it got taken advantage of or some mechanics/strategies ruined
1 Garbage unplayable 

With games there can be issues to reduce the quality of the game or the story that change the overall experience.

 Warlords of Battlecry 3
Gameplay 
4	Many people take the easiest route the warrior and rush through the game
Replayability	
5	Most classes offer a significantly different method of play 
Version	
2	Changes to the game are a matter of opinion made by fans

Overall 	3.67 out of 5 average

If switched back to official version

Overall	4.5 out of 5 average


Unofficial patch has changed the game too much from what it was and there is a way to remove those changes from the game in the forums as it falls so far from the original game which many of the good reviews are about. These changes have re-balanced many of the units and heroes to suit more of an arena style of play. For an actual change log you would have go to the site in order to see the full list. 

This is one of the best RTS games of it's time and although the graphics have aged quite a bit it allowed you to greatly customise your hero and allow many different tactics to be used with each team. There are a total of 16 different races (some better against others) and a large game world to explore in a series of skirmishes or short missions. The major focus was on the hero and it's development in the game which race or races would it lead into battle, what are it's skills going to be and what equipment their was. While it is possible to play the game without heroes there was also no limit to their development. Races are not balanced or set to a specific play style you will need to use different tactics to stand a chance when faced with a racial mismatch but the game is almost always win-able.

The unofficial patch heroes for example have had many of their abilities changed to empower warrior type characters. New spell sets have been added and mage abilities changed to better suit the method of the modders. Summons are the most noticeable difference as you now have a limited duration on units that would likely have died due to a lack of healing from your team. The magic system in short has been altered to prevent some tactics and give others a chance if they unload all their spells at once a much harder system for people to learn.

Most units from what I can remember from the original have had at least one value changed from cost to massive increases to health, armor or damage. This isn't a small change either with some of them getting double health or similar changes. The result is an over developed patched version of a game that was good by itself. 

Unfortunately it seems to be a case of if it ain't broken why fix it. The game is less friendly than the original for new people and many older players want their classic game back. You could call this Warlords Battlecry 4 for all the changes they have done but they aren't good ones. Play the version you want and try the 1.30B patch in compadibility mode before you judge the game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198026070142', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 785, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 631, 'last_played': 1455484208}
review:
Here's the short version of my review: This game came out well after the groundbreaking RTS Warcraft III: reign of Chaos, but it represents an independent creator's attempt at perfecting his craft and coming up with some brilliant mechanics along the way. This is in my opinion one of the all time greats for real time strategy because of its bold hybrid nature, original soundtrack and voice acting, and ahead of its time mechanics. This is the very definition of a cult classic video game.

Here's the long version: This game has an incredible number of stream lined RTS features that put it WAY beyond its time in terms of utility and functionality. Resource gathering is a little similar to that found in a Relic RTS (CoH or dawn of war) in that resources are based on "territory" capture (I put in quotes because the resource buildings must be captured by either your hero or one of his generals).  Buildings had the ability to set continuous production on any pattern of units or upgrades you wanted. Each unit can be set to behave according to a huge number of AI scripts including scout/rampage (useful in the age-old RTS conundrum of when your opponent is hiding one villager somewhere on the map with a secret little building and you dont want to have to search endlessly).

Above all else is the ability to make a persistent hero with his own posse of regular ole soldiers who rise above the ranks and stick with you above and beyond battles. This concept is what got me into this game in the first place and its something that saddens me to not have found its way into any other RTS's (that I know of). 

The heroes are many and their abilities are interesting but one of the things I was not a big fan of when I first played the game was the plot driven campaign (I always liked Warlords Battlecry II's Total War style campaign map). I did warm up to this later on and I now view it as an improvement. 

Whats further incredible about this game is the sheer number of sides with very unique mechanics for each one. There is a side for everyone to take up and enjoy. (Undead take little wimpy skelemen and turn them into apocalyptic harbingers of death... dark dwarves can use their engineers to build massive siege buildings... There's an entire race of fairy people that were extremely broken but seriously who would stoop so low as to play as a giant race of pixies?) Most of all, each side has a unique feel that is spot on. 

There are a ton of other features that I often miss when I play other RTS's as well but I only wanted to highlight my favorites.

In conclusion this niche classic is a fantastic time killer and quite a bit of fun. Whenever I look at spending money on a game I ask myself how many subway sandwiches is this thing worth? Is Warlords Battlecry 3 worth two subway sandwiches? Absolutely. I mean seriously. I eat subway sandwiches and then poop them out. This gave me hours of entertainment just now. I started writing this. Played like 6 missions in the campaign and enjoyed it a great deal. Easily worth 10 bucks. Buy the game. Maybe they'll make WBC IV someday. Maybe.

author: {'steamid': '76561197961862907', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 45, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 45, 'last_played': 1453584566}

This game may have its fans that it boasts about, but I will not be one of them.

author: {'steamid': '76561198067584523', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 36, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 27, 'last_played': 1697015673}
review:
Pour avoir ya longtemps téléchargé le jeux sans l'acheter et y avoir jouer
un bon moment, peux vous dire que ce jeu est térrible.

Ont a un personnage principale, le héros qui dois partir à la conquette
de la carte mais attention, il faut construire sa base car le but du
jeu ici est d'aller massacrer l'autre joueur, ça ressemble un
peut à Command And Conquer comme type de jeu.

Ont dois aller collecter des ressource pour pouvoir construire
notre base et le but aller exploser l'autre.

Le jeu ce déroule donc toujours ainsi.
Bien entendus ya une histoire à suivre !

Il existe aussi un éditeur de niveau
ce qui est excelent aussi !

Le jeue est en anglais mais il existe un patch pour le mettre
complètement et français, voix comprise.

Ah et aussi, le heros évolue aussi, il gagne de l'xp
quand il tue et d'autres truc, il augmente de niveau.

Bref un jeu méchament addictif !

author: {'steamid': '76561197974146288', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 8, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 8, 'last_played': 1453717425}

author: {'steamid': '76561197985489429', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 120, 'playtime_forever': 5, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 5, 'last_played': 1453661341}
review:
I played this game when it was brand-new.  At the time, I was certain that the future of RTS gaming would change... sadly, this is one of the few great RPG RTS games out there.  

You actually aquire and level characters that persist into the next map... so long as they survive... and side quests on the map as well.  

I highly recommend this game, especially if you are an RTS fan.

Unfortunately, the only thing I have against it are the low rez graphics, due to the dated nature of the game.  They appear blurry at 1024x768.  I have a feeling they will probably release an HD version at some point... or Hope.

author: {'steamid': '76561198043773339', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 51, 'playtime_forever': 417, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 177, 'last_played': 1537495841}
review:
They kneel before me.

Scream LOUDER!

I am DEATH.

You need more men!

So many memories from this game.  For anyone who was around for the original Warlords BC series, this was the pinnacle of their game system.  Some might say that WBC 2 was the most interesting in terms of character building and campaign, but this one stands in contrast to that one in the freedom it offers.

The freedom is almost overwhelming at first.  Which race/class combination to choose?  Because you can choose any of any.  Undead paladin?  Fey Necromancer?  Orcish Merchant?  All doable.  It stokes the imagination.

However, the graphics and ui haven't aged well.  Other modern games do it better.  You can't play in windowed mode, for instance, though if you set up your monitor a certain way, it won't stretch the graphics on a wide screen.  The art style isn't bad, per se.  It's very colorful in contrast to former entries to the series.  And the number of effects are pretty satisfying to look at if you're able to look at them through nostalgia glasses (provided you've been around long enough to be nostalgic.).

Anyway, I still say this is the best of the mid-late nineties early 2000's RTS genre.  It's the pinnacle of all the warcraft and starcraft.  And to boot, you get a hero that persists through all your battles.  It's fun having that continuity in a game of this kind.

author: {'steamid': '76561198052187998', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 22, 'playtime_forever': 4150, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 557, 'last_played': 1644975652}
review:
I love this game and had played it for 1000+ hours in my youth. However, I really can't recommend this version of the game at all as it includes fan patches that not only fix the bugs but also change the gameplay drastically.

Scroll down for what I said when I thought this was the official version and what I'd restore along with a recommendation if it is reverted to the official version.

It's like having a reunion with a long lost childhood friend, only to find that, during our long separation, aliens have abducted him, experimented on him and gave him an extensive modification before letting him go. While these modifications are, according to the aliens, improvement, the person is no longer your childhood friend but a total stranger wearing your friend's face. 

So, if you've played the official version and is planning on getting this for nostalgia's sake you should at least find out what the fan patch changes and decide whether or not you could live with it.

Original Review

Note that I'll be approaching this game from a(n extremely) nostalgic point of view.

The moment I saw this game on steam, the first thing I was checking if my eyes were deceiving me.
And when I could confirm that it is really here, I bought it without any hesitation.
This game literally is my childhood. While it is certainly not the first RTS I've ever played, It's certainly what instill the love of the genre in me.

On to the game itself, there are two features which, to me, give this game the charm that even modern RTSs couldn't match; the hero system and the races.

There are 16 races in this game and all of them are almost completely unique (there're a few units that turn up in more than one races, like peasants, the builder unit for both Knights and Empire). While this introduce some balance problems (like how the Orcs have limited anti air capabilities while the Demons have air superiority, which will put Orcs at a disadvantage should the two races are put to fight each other), the variety results in an almost endless strategic possibilities and is like a playground for a child's imagination. Even as an adult, I still sometimes think back to the days before I lost the disc and imagine how the races interact with another. There're few games that let war elephants duke it out with a freaking T-rex (yes, there are T-rexes in this game, and it's almost worth buying just for them alone).

And now for the hero system, instead of playing separate battles and begin anew every time, you create persistent heroes (which you can choose from all the sixteen races and twenty eight classes, in an almost RPG-like system) and have them, and their retinue of hand-picked troops, leading the battles. While this, again, creates balance problems (as a level 50+ hero could probably stemroll an entire base lead by a level 1 hero, even though there are temporary heroes and no heroes mode designed to avoid that), it also leads to a very satisfyinng gameplay as you build your hero up, finding new gears and gaining new abilities and more overpowered retinues. The system let you immerse yourself in your hero's journey and exercise your imagination. Even after many, many year, I still remember fondly my favourite hero, a Ssrathi (basically half man, half snake) Paladin, equally skilled in close combat and healing Magic, bodyguarded by a T-rex, a Minotaur King (who is as tall as the T-rex), a Knight Lord, a High Elven Moonguard and a white dragon. Isn't that awesome? That's the kind of experience this game gives. And of course, ther're so many other builds out there that could satisfy basically any idea.

The game isn't without its flaw and even its huge fan like me acknowledges that. It seems to focus on diversity of builds and strategies rather than balance, the point I've already brought up (twice). And the graphic is pretty old even in 2004 (when it came out) and is completely outdated in 2016. Still, if you can get past that and you like RTSs, RPGs or a great mix of both, I believe this game will satisfy your need and your imagination quite nicely.

author: {'steamid': '76561198038914145', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 84, 'playtime_forever': 519, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 32, 'last_played': 1578931959}
review: Jedna z najlepszych gier RTS jak dla mnie - nawet do dzisiaj. Dobry klimat, wciągający gameplay i nieliniowy tryb fabularny. Mimo, że gra jest dość stara (2004 rok) to nadal może urzec niejednego gracza. Około 27 klas bohaterów, 16 ras i ponad 130 zaklęć co daje nam dość spore pole do popisu i kreacji naszego unikalnego bohatera. W grze spędziłem około pół roku, oczywiście wiele lat temu, ale jestem pewny, że od teraz, gdy mam tą grę na Steam nieraz do niej powrócę. To co również zapadło mi w pamięć to dialogi, które są zależne od rasy, którą gramy i jej nastawienia do rasy rozmówcy.

author: {'steamid': '76561197972426666', 'num_games_owned': 1190, 'num_reviews': 177, 'playtime_forever': 70, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 58, 'last_played': 1693798689}
review:
This is definately an older game at this point, but a very enjoyable old school RTS. I played it back before it was on steam (and eventually lost my copy, and was so excited that I immediately bought three copies for me and others.)

It has more races than any other RTS I've seen.
It has more resources than any other RTS I've seen.
It has heros, it has leveling, and it has dragons.

It's also the only game I've seen that makes the phrase, "Spring is in the air!" send shivers of fear for your imminant doom down your spine.

author: {'steamid': '76561198039439581', 'num_games_owned': 339, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1947, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 126, 'last_played': 1680989816}
review: This game is up there in the most hours I have ever spent in a game. As a matter of fact, I found my old disk and have been playing it frequently for the past few weeks, so, seeing it on steam I  picked it up and it's just as good as I remeber it to be. 100% would reccomend, modern RTS games should take a page from Battlecry's book and get it on point.

author: {'steamid': '76561198030863487', 'num_games_owned': 687, 'num_reviews': 195, 'playtime_forever': 239, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 239, 'last_played': 1453593542}
review:
Instead of repeating myself, i will offer a few excerpts from my Is it worth it? Review. The link will be posted below.

This game was a basic copy-paste with NO upgrades to be had to moderrnize it for newer systems. YOU ONLY HAVE 3 RESOLUTION OPTIONS:
800x600
1024x968
1280x1024
THATS IT!!

Now, I do have to say that it was like curling up with a blanket on a rainy day and reading one of your old favorite novels with a glass of warm brandy and a nice wood fire to keep you company.... BUUUUUUUTTTTT.........

The game’s asking price after the initial release discount has gone away is $10 US. And I do have to say that it felt good to play around with an old-style RTS like this again. However, given the current price tags of other RTS’s that have more interesting story, better graphics, and more modern mechanics… I would have to say to give this one a pass guys.. At LEAST until there’s a steam sale or the price gets cut roughly in half. 

You can see my full review here: https://youtu.be/2TJPjS0f3pE

review:
Are you a Reaver.... oh, yes?
On a bright day, would you say "aaaaah, sunshine on my leaves?"
Have you ever pointed your finger at an enemy and screamed "YOU WERE WARNED!"
When you see your significant other, do you ever think "mmmm...warm flesh"
Whenever you click on a building in other RTS, are you sad that people don't scream in horrible agony?
Have you ever ended an argument by venomously stating "There will be no discussion!"
When standing by your friends in conflict, would you only fight if paid?  Or only get paid when fighting?
DISEMBOWEL HIM, SIR!

But in all seriousness, will you join our rabble?

author: {'steamid': '76561198031908641', 'num_games_owned': 825, 'num_reviews': 18, 'playtime_forever': 836, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1560031728}
review:
O que falar sobre este jogo: Se formos analisar comparando com os jogos de estratégia encontrados na atualidade, este será bem simples e até mesmo relativamente fácil de se jogar e se vencer, principalmente a IA. Nunca encontrei grandes dificuldades de vencer a IA nem mesmo em mapas com todos contra mim! Ainda assim, naõ se deixe enganar pela sua simplicidade pois o jogo em si ele é incrivelmente rico, naõ somente pelas histórias mas também pela diversidade de facções com as quais você terá disponível, além das classes disponibilizadas para a criação do seu herói.

De começo, você deve criar seu herói escolhendo uma das diversas facções e uma das diversas classes disponibilizadas, ou seja, você tem em suas mãos uma grande gama de possibilidades. Ao começar a jogar, TODO e QUALQUER tipo de jogo que você se disponha a jogar poderá contabilizar benefícios para seu herói e consequentemente para o seu jogo, seja em forma de itens, XP, unidades, não importa, você pode jogar tanto a campanha, quanto um multiplayer ou um random game que os benefício ganhos naquela partida continuarão com seu herói.

Mesmo com esse detalhe que mencionei, o jogo não se engana. Sempre que você terminar uma partida, o save daquela mesma partida será deletado, impossibilitando que os espertos de plantão entrem no jogo e ganhem ainda mais benefícios rapidamente. Outro detalhe é que não importa o quanto voicê se fortaleça, cada nova partida o jogo criará heróis inimigos que estarão sempre em níveis próximos ao seu e claro, dependendo do modo de jogo, as torres iniciais poderão ser tão fortes quanto seu herói (uma maneira de evitar que um herói OP entre sozinho em uma base inimiga, destrua tudo e ganhe o jogo em menos de um minuto).

Outro detalhe importante é o seu "retinue", uma quantidade de unidades que você pode ir carregando com você após cada missão ou mapa jogado. Antes de cada partida, os jogadores podem escolher algumas unidades para acompanhá-lo no início. Cada uma delas tem um custo em pontos, o qual é limitado por cada tipo de mapa. Os retinues são exatamente como essas unidades, no entanto eles já vem com um nível maior (ganho em batalhas anteriores), facilitando assim a sobrevivência no começo de cada partida. Lembrando que quanto maior o nível do personagem, maior será seu custo em pontos.

Enfim, eu poderia passar a tarde inteira aqui falando sobre este jogo, mas minha melhor recomendação é: Assistam gameplays sobre ele e se possível joguem na conta de um amigo ou por algum Family Share para tirar suas conclusões.

author: {'steamid': '76561197995232114', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 3606, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 89, 'last_played': 1704824541}
review:
This is one of my all time favorite games. I've been playing it solidly since its release in 2004. When I saw WBC3 on steam, I picked it up so I that I wouldn't need to use the CD anymore.

This is the series that first introduced Heroes to RTS's, and they did it better than anyone else. The 'heroes' in WarCraft 3 don't even come close.

Unfortunately, the steam version of this game uses the player-made patches which, in my opinion, are inferior to the official patches. It's because of this that summoned troops have cooldowns and the game breaks emersion by talking about bitches when your buildings are being claimed.

Sad. But, even with the use of the inferior player-made patches, Warlords Battlecry 3 is still better than virtually any other RTS out there.

author: {'steamid': '76561198017586082', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 49, 'playtime_forever': 8964, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 841, 'last_played': 1484883940}
review: An incredible labor of love, a great selection of units, heroes, spells, items, quests, and fun! Also, it's pretty well balanced after 1.03.23 fix, and I highly suggest checking out the wikia to download the unofficial official patch. It adds improvemenst to the game that the devs did not have time to implement, due to arbitrary publisher deadlines. A really, really solid RTS and RPG! I cannot recommend this game enough!

author: {'steamid': '76561197992915377', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 27, 'playtime_forever': 320, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 320, 'last_played': 1453642805}
review:
Not going to lie.. this game hasn't aged well, AT ALL.

but the gameplay is there, and will mostly appeal to nostalgia seekers (can't belive 2004 is now considered nostalgia).

It is RTS mixed with RPG. Think warcraft 3 but less polished. However, there is a big list of playable races with it's own units and niches. A ton of different classes to play with and different schools of magic to learn.

The game has alot of diversity, and we are thankful that it is now on Steam after all this time. We can only hope that this means there will be some bug fixing support, or they are testing the waters to see the demand for a new game in the series. (we are allowed to dream)

Al in all, it is fun.

author: {'steamid': '76561197996680806', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 21, 'playtime_forever': 1212, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 901, 'last_played': 1454614455}

author: {'steamid': '76561197977689581', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 6, 'playtime_forever': 4392, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 331, 'last_played': 1649102115}
review:
This is one of my most favorite RTS games. It has a heavy blend of RPG elements like a hero that carries over between battles, 29 classes to specialize with and even all your units can gain exp and level up. You can also keep a retinue of leveled up soldiers to bring into more skirmishes.

There are 16 races to play with, almost all of them having some theme or special trait unique to them. The downside is that with so many races, a few of them feel a little lacking in depth or unit variety, especially if you were to compare them with the factions from other rts games like starcraft or dawn of war.

The campaign mode is decent,  but I liked the campaign from the second game way better. It actually feels like a less polished version of the previous game's campaign.

Aside from all that its a pretty old game now, I think the graphics are still tolerable and I have encountered a few minor bugs, but I still strongly recommend it.

I've also heard theres a pretty rad mod for this game, but I havn't checked it out yet.

author: {'steamid': '76561198027509426', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 37, 'playtime_forever': 550, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 550, 'last_played': 1453875343}
review: The mouse flickers from time to time. It mostly just happens in the main menu but otherwise it runs very well. Great considering it's age and that it could be played on a 98 PC. Brings sback so much nostalgia and I look forward to play more of it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198002511762', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 125, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 14, 'last_played': 1615114128}
review:
The most generic RPG-RTS you will ever play, also one of the best.

It's an RPG/RTS that lets you carry hero stats over from game-to-game, it also has an expansive open RPG style single player campaign that's a lot of fun, it also has a hardcore mode for heroes that includes perma-death.

Units also gain EXP and levels, and what's really cool is your heroes get to carry over some units at the end of each game if you'd like, so on top of game-to-game hero stats you also get to try and hold on to a group of elite units that you try to foster into high level killing machines, as long as they don't die.

I grew up playing this game, and graphically, mechanically, it's nothing special, but the sheer BULK of units, races, heroes, and fun is enough to make this game worth every penny you will spend on it.

I'm getting some thumbs down so maybe I'm not being clear enough. This is a very good RTS-RPG on all levels with a huge amount of content, but it is simply very generic in its theme, that's all.

It's not even generic in a bad way, it just has all the classic units and races you'd expect or want.

The weakest part of the game overall is probably the graphics which were not that great when it came out in the first place, some units also feel a bit out of place graphically when you take the art themes into account, sort of like when units are added with a mod and they don't look like the same person made them.

Oh, and it would be best if you didn't buy this for the MP, I'm not sure what sort of hoops you're going to need to jump through to get it working.

author: {'steamid': '76561198102192545', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 279, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 202, 'last_played': 1710641407}
review:
非常好玩的老游戏！

从我上高中的时候就一直在玩了，非常高兴能看到登录steam平台，希望还有续作！

author: {'steamid': '76561198002993339', 'num_games_owned': 502, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 919, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 129, 'last_played': 1705501454}
review:
很久前就希望呼啸战神3能上steam了，这次果断一出就买！
本游戏最有趣的部分就是他的英雄养成吧，几乎可以当成是RPG游戏了。16个种族和28个职业随你喜欢随意组合，什么恶魔圣骑士、牛头人酋长、野蛮人贤者，能都能在游戏里体验。战斗中还会随机出现可以接受任务的地点和贩卖装备和药水的店。
最主要的还是游戏中的英雄不同于一般的RTS而类似于RPG游戏，建立后除非玩铁人模式（获得经验增加但是英雄死亡后自动删除）不然就会一直存在保留你之前战斗获得的装备和等级,你可以在遭遇战和剧情中继续使用。大部分兵种单位获得一定经验后还会成为随从，以后的战斗你都可以选择他/她/它出战，不过随从在战斗中死亡可没办法复活。
剧情模式也十分丰富，移动途中的随机小战斗，去到城市还会受到对城市所属种族的外交影响，如果是敌对状态就别想在这里雇佣佣兵和购物了，还有可能在路上就被伏击。
具体还是进入游戏体验一下吧，不过鉴于是04年的游戏画面什么的当然不咋地。而且除了版本为1.03.24外好像并没有额外的升级所以(个人觉得1.03比较好，如果可以自选版本就好了).........嘛反正才27就算喜+1也没什么，有兴趣的都来试试吧！！！

author: {'steamid': '76561198009093962', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 284, 'playtime_forever': 185, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 17, 'last_played': 1462072283}
review:
An absolutely incredible RTS with heavy RPG elements, Warlords Battlecry III is still one of my favorite games to this day.  With almost a dozen and a half well-balanced races to choose from, the replayability value is absolutely insane and every race has several viable strategies that will work to use their strengths against their opponents' weaknesses.  Creating your leader, a hero, is also extremely rewarding from the nearly infinite number of builds that you could create.

The gameplay and story are a worthy pairing for the mechanics even if it does sound somewhat familiar to that of a standard adventure RPG cliche.  A great evil is rising and threatens to overtake the world.  Your chosen faction is determined to defeat it and, through your choices, you will make many allies and enemies of the other factions as you travel throughout the world accomplishing what you must to do so.  The world map is interesting with lore behind every location and tons and tons of content to explore as the game is very non-linear.  Combat is also a fun experience where each faction's strengths and weaknesses can be used to your advantage.  Each faction has its own unique units and buildings as well as its own level of priority for the four resources of the game.  For example, the Dwarves faction uses a ton of metal, the Daemons are heavily based on stone and crystal, and the Empire prioritizes gold, though, each of these factions will find itself needed at least a little of these key resources to truly build a respectable army.

Your faction, whether you choose a fantasy classic like the Knights or Dark Elves, or a more unique one like the disease-carrying Plague Lords, or the lizardman-like Ssrathi, is an absolute blast to play.  Each has a list of armies and buildings that are almost entirely different from the other races as well as a separate tech tree.  Your hero, however, is the ultimate icing on the cake in my opinion.  With sixteen races and twenty-eight classes to choose from you could never tire of trying out different combinations to create vastly different heroes.  Each race provides six skills for you hero and each class does the same.  Each level that you achieve in the game provides you with a point to improve these skills and further improve and specialize your build.

I would recommend this game to all RTS fans as well as those who love fantasy RPGs.  This is a great game that to this day I don't tire of.  I purchased it instantly as soon as I saw it on Steam and wanted to get the word out that it is an absolute gem!

author: {'steamid': '76561198029681601', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 12, 'playtime_forever': 1121, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 428, 'last_played': 1542858529}
review:
Сама игра - одна из лучших фентези RTS. Затрудняюсь сказать, сколько раз я прошел кампанию. Огромное количество различных рас и классов. Потрясающая озвучка юнитов только способствует погруженю в атмосферу игры. Чего стоят только фразы личей у фракции Нежити:"Богохульства! Я бросаю вызов Богу!". Персонажа после завершения кампании можно прокачивать и дальше, благо есть множество повторяющихся миссий на карте. В конечном итоге персонаж становится терминатором (у меня у самого Темный гном-алхимик 91 уровня, а на ютубе есть видео от лица 195 уровня рыцаря-убийцы).

И вот эта замечательная игра наконец-то добралась до стима, спустя каких-то 12 лет. Этому я сначала обрадовался, потому что дисковода у меня на ПК нет, сам диск от Акеллы с чертовым старфорсом, а игра уже достаточно старая. Поэтому даже когда дисковод у меня был, на Windows 7 она просто не запускалась. Но улыбка быстро сошла с моего лица, когда я запустил игру. Какой она была 12 лет назад, такой ее нам и высра...выпустили в следующем виде:

1) Стоит патч 1.03.24, который не исправляет критические баги патча 1.03. А патч 1.03 в свою очередь(насколько я помню, в 1.02 такого не было) ввел кулдаун на применение заклинаний. Как это выглядит: после применения заклинания появляется синяя полоска, которая постепенно заполняется. Если во время заполнения полоски попытаться прочитать еще одно заклинание (любое), игра вылетает на рабочий стол.  Кроме этого есть и другие баги, на которые разработчики плевать хотели. Решение есть - это ставить неофициальный патч 1.03.25, но лучше бы его вшили в игру.

2)Доступна только английская версия. По моему скромному мнению, озвучка юнитов от Акеллы намного лучше. Потанцевав с бубном, я вернул русскую озвучку, описания предметов и так далее. Но могли бы просто дать выбор какой-то пользователям(игра локализована на множество языков), а не выплевывать одну версию.

3)Нет поддержки стим оверлея.

4)Нет поддержки широкоформатных мониторов. Мне не сложно играть на 1024х768, хотя глаза напрягаются. Но интерфейс главного меню и игры в целом уходит за пределы экрана. Из-за чего мягко говоря игрок испытывает дискомфорт.

Из плюсов конкретно этой версии я могу отметить только то, что она каким-то чудом запустилась на Windows 8.1.

author: {'steamid': '76561198020814505', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 20010, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 602, 'last_played': 1628865146}
review:
I instantly bought this game when it was available, because I was so happy that this game was finally on Steam! I have been playing the demo for a long time and couldn't get the full version in my hands.

The Warlords Battlecry series are classic fantasy RTS games. With lots of races to choose from, and classes available for customizing your hero, you will lead your own campaign in conquering the riches of the land of Etheria!

Also:
"1...2...3, BERSERKER!!!" Dwarves for the win!!
